prologue.label: Prologue
prologue.title: Memory Load
prologue.text:
Your phone is face-down, but you can feel the weight of it — five names pressing into one night.

You try to sleep.

Instead, your mind runs a highlight reel out of order:

• A woman in a blazer, voice calm in a crisis, looking at you like competence is a kind of truth.
• A preschool hallway, tiny shoes lined neatly, a familiar laugh that makes you feel seen.
• Sapa — mist on your lashes, a stranger’s smile turning a temporary place into a permanent memory.
• A close friend group, one person who knows your patterns and still chooses gentleness.
• A sacred journey, where a nurse teaches you that sincerity is a discipline.

The memories don’t explain themselves yet.

They just ask one question:

Who were you with each of them — before anyone asked you to choose?

choices.text: Let the memories come without trying to control the order.

backstory_kira.label: Prologue
backstory_kira.title: Quiet Authority
backstory_kira.text:
It starts with fluorescent light and urgency.

Kira didn’t ask for help like most people do. She placed a problem on the table and watched whether you would flinch.

A data leak. A blame game. A room full of anxious voices — and her calm, precise control.

When you stayed steady, she didn’t smile. She simply delegated. That was her version of trust.

Later, as the office lights dimmed, she said quietly, almost like a warning: ‘I hate owing anyone.’

You understood the real meaning: she hates being vulnerable. And she was telling you anyway.

The scene breaks — not ending, just dissolving — the way memories do when you’re not ready to live in them.

choices.text: Promise consistency — show up without making her ask twice.
Keep it professional — treat it as a one-time collaboration.
Enough. Open your eyes. Go back to tonight.

backstory_jannah.label: Prologue
backstory_jannah.title: Steady Warmth
backstory_jannah.text:
It starts with warmth that never demanded attention.

Jannah Raudah has always had the kind of presence that makes people lower their guard.

You remember schooldays: her waiting at the corridor, offering a snack like it was nothing, never asking why you were quiet.

Now, at her preschool, you see her in her element — gentle voice, firm boundaries, children orbiting her like she is safety.

When she looks up at you, the smile is familiar. Not demanding. Not accusing.

Just the kind of welcome that makes you realize how long you’ve been gone.

The scene breaks — not ending, just dissolving — the way memories do when you’re not ready to live in them.

choices.text: Be honest — tell her you’ve missed her more than you admitted.
Play safe — keep her in the ‘old friend’ category.
Enough. Open your eyes. Go back to tonight.

backstory_dasha.label: Prologue
backstory_dasha.title: Mist and Motion
backstory_dasha.text:
It starts with mist, and a stranger who felt like a mirror.

Sapa taught you that the world can disappear in seconds.

Dasha Taran stood by the railings as fog climbed over the valleys, her jacket zipped to the chin, her eyes bright like she was listening to the mountains breathe.

She told you she was from Kazakhstan, travelling without a schedule strict enough to become a prison.

Then she asked, lightly, like it was just conversation: ‘What are you running from?’

You didn’t answer. But she smiled like she heard it anyway.

The scene breaks — not ending, just dissolving — the way memories do when you’re not ready to live in them.

choices.text: Share a truth you rarely tell — and let her see the real you.
Keep it beautiful but shallow — protect yourself with charm.
Enough. Open your eyes. Go back to tonight.

backstory_xinyi.label: Prologue
backstory_xinyi.title: Home, Suddenly
backstory_xinyi.text:
It starts with familiarity — the kind that becomes risk.

Xin Yi belongs to the part of your life that already has history — not destiny, not fate, just years of being there.

She’s in your close friend group, the kind of person who knows your patterns without using them against you.

That’s why she is dangerous.

Because one quiet night, when everyone else had left and the room finally stopped performing, she didn’t flirt or push.

She just looked at you like you were a decision you hadn’t had the courage to make.

And you realized comfort isn’t always safe.
Sometimes comfort is the thing you lose because you assumed it would wait forever.

The scene breaks — not ending, just dissolving — the way memories do when you’re not ready to live in them.

choices.text: Choose clarity — admit this isn’t just friendship anymore.
Delay it — pretend it’s nothing, because nothing is easier.
Enough. Open your eyes. Go back to tonight.

backstory_almah.label: Prologue
backstory_almah.title: Umrah of Mercy
backstory_almah.text:
It starts with intention, and the silence after prayer.

Almahirah is Singaporean — a nurse who learned early that care is not sentiment, it’s stamina.

But you didn’t meet her for the first time in Mecca.

Ten years ago, back home, she was your first real *almost* — the kind of love that felt simple until life made it complicated. You were younger, hungry, always building the next version of yourself. She was one year younger than you, steady in a way you didn’t yet know how to keep. You dated long enough to learn each other’s rhythms… and ended it the way immature people end good things: with pride, bad timing, and words that never became closure.

After that, you didn’t stay friends. You didn’t stay enemies either.

You just… didn’t stay.

Then fate folds the years and drops you into the same place: Mecca, during Umrah — a season when you were tired of being clever.

You recognize her before you’re ready to.

She moves with the same quiet discipline: checking on an elderly pilgrim, offering water, adjusting a scarf without making a scene — like mercy is a job she does well, not a performance she sells.

When you speak, she doesn’t romanticize you. She doesn’t ask why you left.

She asks one thing instead: ‘What kind of man are you when no one is watching?’

It lands like a test you can’t charm your way out of.

The scene breaks — not ending, just dissolving — the way memories do when you’re not ready to live in them.

choices.text: Let her counsel land — choose sincerity over performance.
Protect yourself — keep your heart behind jokes and distance.
Enough. Open your eyes. Go back to tonight.

arrival.label: Chapter One
arrival.title: Five Messages, One Night
arrival.text:
Back in Singapore, the week arrives like a bill.

Your phone lights up with five messages — none dramatic, none harmless.

Kira needs you for something delicate at work: a situation that can’t be handled through official channels.

Jannah invites you to dinner after a long day at the preschool — a simple message that feels heavier than it should.

Dasha texts from Sapa: she’s leaving soon, and she asks if you still remember the mist.

Xin Yi wants to meet — comfort that has always been close, now asking for something more honest.

Almahirah sends a short voice note after her shift: ‘If you’re still in a season of choosing… choose what makes you better.’

You only have enough time to answer one properly tonight.

choices.text: Go to Kira — show up the way she respects most: practical, precise, present.
Choose Jannah — unhurried honesty, the kind you keep postponing.
Call Dasha — accept that some connections are rare because they don’t repeat.
Meet Xin Yi — the close friend who’s become the most dangerous kind of comfort.
Reply Almahirah — ask her to speak plainly: what do you do when love becomes a test?

xinyi_meet.label: Chapter One
xinyi_meet.title: Too Familiar
xinyi_meet.text:
With Xin Yi, conversation feels easy — which is exactly why it scares you.

She knows your habits: how you delay hard conversations, how you hide behind jokes, how you try to keep everyone happy.

She doesn’t demand a confession.

She simply refuses to let you disappear behind comfort.

‘Are you meeting me because you missed me,’ she asks, ‘or because you’re finally ready to be honest about what I am to you?’

choices.text: Answer properly: choose clarity over comfort.
Delay again: ask for time you don’t deserve.

kira_plans.label: Chapter One
kira_plans.title: Quiet Authority
kira_plans.text:
Kira’s calm efficiency is magnetic. You follow her lead, and she trusts you with decisions she usually keeps to herself.

The room is tense. The stakes are real. And yet she is steady — as if steadiness is the only language she believes in.

You realize something uncomfortable: for Kira, affection is a form of trust. And trust is earned in silence.

choices.text: Match her pace and deliver the plan flawlessly.
Ask what she’s not saying — risk tenderness in the middle of competence.

jannah_talk.label: Chapter One
jannah_talk.title: Steady Warmth
jannah_talk.text:
Jannah listens without hurry. The way she remembers small details makes the room feel safe again.

Dinner is simple. The conversation is quieter than your usual life.

And that is exactly why you feel exposed — because she makes honesty feel possible.

choices.text: Be fully present and honest with her.
Ask her advice about the others.

dasha_walk.label: Chapter One
dasha_walk.title: Mist and Motion
dasha_walk.text:
Dasha’s voice arrives with wind in the background.

She sounds calm, amused, a little far away — like she is already half-packed for the next place.

Then she asks, softly: ‘If you met me again, would you choose better… or choose safer?’

You hear the question beneath the question: are you brave enough to be real?

choices.text: Share a story you rarely tell.
Keep it light but let the silence linger.

almah_talk.label: Chapter One
almah_talk.title: What Makes You Better
almah_talk.text:
Almahirah meets you without romance in her eyes — only sincerity.

She just finished a shift. You can hear the tiredness in the way she breathes.

And it hits you, quietly: you still recognize that breath. Ten years ago, you used to wait for it to settle beside you on late nights, thinking that was what love meant.

Yet she speaks carefully now, like every word is an amanah.

‘People think love is a feeling,’ she says. ‘But love is what you do when your nafs wants the easy thing.’

She doesn’t say “we’ve been here before.”

She doesn’t have to.

Her presence feels like accountability — and accountability is strangely intimate, especially coming from someone who already knew your worst version.

choices.text: Ask her to be part of your life beyond advice — and mean it.
Keep it distant: thank her and change the subject.

crossroads.label: Chapter Two
crossroads.title: Patterns Begin
crossroads.text:
The night shifts.

Each bond has weight now — not because anyone demanded it, but because your choices made it real.

You’re a tech engineer. You’ve spent your whole life believing that if you keep enough options open, you’ll eventually choose correctly.

But people aren’t systems.

Tomorrow begins Chapter Two — where choices stop being moments and start becoming patterns.

(Chapter Two will now branch deeper and won’t merge immediately.)

choices.text: Enter Chapter Two (deeper branching).

chapter2_start.label: Chapter Two
chapter2_start.title: One Calendar, Many Collisions
chapter2_start.text:
Monday morning in Singapore.

Kira is your boss. The team is shipping. The dashboards are alive with risk.

And yet your personal life refuses to wait for a ‘less busy week’.

This month won’t be five clean routes.

It will be collisions — people arriving at the wrong time, overlapping in the same space, forcing choices you can’t postpone.

choices.text: Start the month with work: Kira pulls you into a Korea escalation plan.
Start with something grounded: Jannah’s world (preschool + real life).
Start with courage: Dasha asks you to meet her again — soon.
Start with comfort: Xin Yi asks for time, not excuses.
Start with accountability: Almahirah invites you into her rhythm (mosque class + post-shift).

c2_kira_gate.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_gate.title: Escalation Week
c2_kira_gate.text:
Kira calls you into a small meeting room.

No small talk. Just stakes.

A Korea client escalation is coming, and she’s putting you on the front line.

‘You’re coming with me,’ she says.

Before you can respond, your phone lights up — Xin Yi.

A simple message: ‘Are you free tonight? I need to talk. Properly.’

choices.text: Choose work first: go with Kira, tell Xin Yi you’ll reschedule.
Choose Xin Yi tonight: ask Kira for flexibility (risky).

c2_kira_1.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_1.title: Seoul Escalation
c2_kira_1.text:
Seoul is cold in the way offices are cold — expectation disguised as politeness.

Kira walks the lobby like she owns the floor plan.

In the war room, it’s dashboards, logs, rollback plans. You perform under pressure.

When the client finally calms down, the team disperses.

In the elevator, Kira’s voice drops:

‘You did well.’

It sounds like intimacy, coming from her.

As you step out, your phone buzzes — Jannah.

A photo: a small classroom display board.

Text: ‘We’re putting up gratitude cards from the kids. Thought of you.’

choices.text: Keep it professional: don’t mix feelings with your boss — reply Jannah warmly instead.
Make it personal: ask Kira why she chose you (crossing a line).

c2_kira_detour_xinyi.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_detour_xinyi.title: Asking for Flexibility
c2_kira_detour_xinyi.text:
Kira’s eyes narrow — not anger, calculation.

‘This isn’t a favor,’ she says. ‘It’s responsibility.’

You feel the power difference sharply. Boss. Engineer. Deadline.

Still, you hold your ground.

‘Give me tonight,’ you say. ‘I’ll make it up.’

Kira considers you for a long second.

‘One night,’ she says. ‘Don’t make it a habit.’

choices.text: Go to Xin Yi and be fully present (no half-attention).
Back out last minute and go to Kira anyway (fear wins).

c2_kira_branch_jannah.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_branch_jannah.title: Two Worlds at Once
c2_kira_branch_jannah.text:
You reply Jannah with something honest.

Kira sees the message preview — just a flicker.

She doesn’t comment, but you feel her notice.

Later, over dinner with colleagues, someone suggests drinks.

Kira stays.

And then, unexpectedly — Dasha texts.

‘I’m in Seoul. One night only. Don’t ask why. Just tell me if you’re real.’

choices.text: Go meet Dasha (rare window, high risk).
Stay with Kira (work loyalty + proximity).

c2_kira_branch_personal.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_branch_personal.title: Why You?
c2_kira_branch_personal.text:
Kira holds your gaze.

‘Because you don’t panic,’ she says.

Then softer, dangerous:

‘And because you don’t make my vulnerability into a transaction.’

That sentence changes the air.

Afterwards, she invites you to a late coffee — not required. Not normal.

Your phone buzzes again.

Almahirah: ‘Are you free this Friday? I’ll be at class. If not, no worries.’

choices.text: Accept Kira’s coffee (lean into the boundary).
Step back: message Almahirah to lock Friday (choose accountability).

c2_kira_afterhours.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_afterhours.title: After Hours
c2_kira_afterhours.text:
Kira talks about systems the way some people talk about feelings — careful, detailed, refusing to be sloppy.

‘Trust is expensive,’ she says.

She doesn’t flirt.

But you realize she’s letting you be close.

A closeness that would cost you if you mishandle it.

Back in your hotel, you see a missed call from Xin Yi.

choices.text: Call Xin Yi immediately (repair before it becomes a pattern).
Sleep. Handle it later. (avoidance in a clean suit).

c2_kira_coffee.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_coffee.title: Coffee That Isn’t About Coffee
c2_kira_coffee.text:
Kira doesn’t smile much, but tonight the edge softens.

She asks about your life — not the sanitized version.

Then she says, quiet:

‘If this becomes messy, it ends your career faster than it ends your feelings.’

She isn’t threatening you.

She’s warning you like someone who doesn’t warn people.

Outside the café, you spot a familiar figure across the street.

Xin Yi.

She’s in Seoul too.

And she sees you with Kira.

choices.text: Go after Xin Yi immediately (damage control + honesty).
Stay with Kira, finish the conversation properly (don’t run).

c2_jannah_gate.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_gate.title: The Charity Day
c2_jannah_gate.text:
Jannah’s weekend charity day arrives with noise and bright colors.

You’re helping set up when you hear a familiar voice behind you.

Xin Yi.

She wasn’t supposed to be here.

She smiles at the kids, then looks at you like she’s checking your honesty.

Two women.
One small space.

And you can’t pretend timing doesn’t mean anything.

choices.text: Stay with Jannah’s world: keep helping, be present, don’t get pulled away.
Step aside with Xin Yi to talk privately (risk how it looks).

c2_dasha_gate.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_gate.title: The Mist Doesn’t Wait
c2_dasha_gate.text:
Dasha’s message is simple.

‘Sapa. Soon. If you’re real.’

You check your workload. You check your bank app. You check your own courage.

Then your phone rings.

Kira.

‘We need you for a Korea escalation plan. This week.’

choices.text: Choose Dasha: book Vietnam anyway (courage over career comfort).
Choose Kira: tell Dasha you can’t make it (distance grows).

c2_xinyi_gate.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_gate.title: The Friend Who Knows You
c2_xinyi_gate.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t message like someone chasing attention.

She messages like someone deciding whether you’re safe.

She asks you to meet.

Halfway through the conversation, your phone lights up.

Kira.

A short line: ‘War room. Now.’

choices.text: Go immediately to Kira (work first).
Tell Kira you’ll join in 30 minutes (risk but honest).

c2_almah_gate.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_gate.title: Accountability
c2_almah_gate.text:
Almahirah’s schedule is brutal.

She offers you a small window: Friday, after class.

The name on your screen feels like an old scar you forgot was still there — not painful, just… present.

You’re about to agree when you see another message.

Dasha: ‘I’m leaving soon.’

Two different kinds of urgency.

One is temporary.

One is principled — because Almahirah isn’t new. She’s the past asking whether you’ve matured.

choices.text: Lock Friday with Almahirah (choose what makes you better).
Chase the disappearing window: prioritize Dasha (rare over steady).

c2_jannah_1.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_1.title: Small Hands, Big Heart
c2_jannah_1.text:
Jannah moves between children like she was built for this — firm when needed, gentle when it matters.

A child cries. Jannah kneels. The panic dissolves.

When she looks up at you, her smile holds relief.

Not because you donated.

Because you stayed.

Then Xin Yi returns to the room with two cups of water — and the glance she gives you is quiet, assessing.

Tonight will force a choice about how you behave in overlapping spaces.

choices.text: Stay openly by Jannah’s side (choose presence, accept the optics).
Split your attention evenly (avoid making a ‘statement’).

c2_xinyi_1.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_1.title: Warmth With Teeth
c2_xinyi_1.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t accuse.

She just says, calmly:

‘I’m not asking to be chosen today. I’m asking if you are the kind of man who keeps people warm while staying undecided.’

You feel the truth of it.

And then, as if the universe is testing timing, Jannah calls.

She sounds tired.

‘Can you come over? Just… for a while.’

choices.text: Go to Jannah (comfort her).
Stay with Xin Yi and finish the hard talk (consistency).

c2_almah_1.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_1.title: After Shift, After Prayer
c2_almah_1.text:
Almahirah looks tired in a way that feels honest.

Nurse fatigue isn’t glamorous. It’s quiet. It’s heavy.

After class, she walks with you for a while — same pacing as ten years ago, like her body remembers the route even if your life pretends it doesn’t.

‘I’m one year younger than you,’ she says, like she’s correcting an assumption. ‘But I’m not younger in the ways that matter.’

She pauses, eyes forward, voice soft — the way she used to speak when she didn’t want to start a fight.

Then she asks:

‘Do you want love… or do you want distraction?’

It isn’t a flirt.

It’s a reunion test.

choices.text: Choose sincerity: ‘I want love that makes me better. Even if it’s hard.’
Choose honesty: ‘I don’t know what I want yet.’

c2_dasha_1.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_1.title: Sunrise in Sapa
c2_dasha_1.text:
Sapa meets you with air so cold it feels clean.

Dasha is already there. She looks at you like she expected you to choose comfort instead.

‘You came,’ she says.

The sunrise is quiet. The mist thins in slow layers.

Then she asks:

‘Are you here because you want me… or because you want to feel brave?’

choices.text: Tell the truth: ‘Both. And I’m tired of pretending that’s wrong.’
Keep it romantic but safe: ‘I just wanted to see you.’

c2_xinyi_phone_repair.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_phone_repair.title: Repair Attempt
c2_xinyi_phone_repair.text:
Xin Yi answers on the second ring.

She doesn’t sound angry.

That’s worse.

‘I’m glad you called,’ she says. ‘I didn’t want to be the kind of person who waits for crumbs.’

She pauses.

‘Tell me the truth. Am I a choice… or a habit?’

choices.text: Say ‘choice’ and back it with a concrete plan (date/time).
Avoid labels: reassure her without committing (dangerous).

c2_dasha_seoul.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_seoul.title: The Rare Window
c2_dasha_seoul.text:
Dasha meets you under Seoul’s neon.

She laughs like she’s trying not to care.

‘One night,’ she says. ‘No lies.’

And then she looks past you — at the hotel entrance.

Kira is there.

Your boss.

Watching.

Not jealous.

Just… seeing.

choices.text: Go to Kira and explain (respect her authority and boundaries).
Stay with Dasha (choose the rare window, accept the fallout).

c2_almah_friday_lock.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_friday_lock.title: Locking Friday
c2_almah_friday_lock.text:
You tell Almahirah you’ll be there Friday.

She doesn’t celebrate.

She just says, quietly:

‘Then keep your word.’

It lands heavier because you didn’t, ten years ago — not in the small ways that mattered.

After you send the message, Xin Yi texts.

‘I miss you. But I don’t miss uncertainty.’

choices.text: Reply with clarity and a plan (don’t leave her hanging).
Say nothing for now (avoidance).

c2_jannah_late_call.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_late_call.title: The Late Call
c2_jannah_late_call.text:
Jannah opens the door looking composed — but her eyes are tired.

She doesn’t dramatize.

She just says:

‘Today was hard.’

Then she adds, softer:

‘And I didn’t want to be alone.’

Your phone buzzes.

Kira.

A work incident alert.

Right now.

choices.text: Stay with Jannah (choose the human over the system).
Go to Kira (incident response; career reality).

c2_xinyi_seoul_collision.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_seoul_collision.title: Spotted
c2_xinyi_seoul_collision.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t yell.

She doesn’t cry.

She just looks at you with a calm disappointment that feels like a door deciding to close.

‘So this is your life,’ she says. ‘And you didn’t think to tell me.’

She starts to walk away.

Kira watches from behind you.

Dasha’s message sits unread.

The city feels too bright.

choices.text: Follow Xin Yi (repair first; pride later).
Stay with Kira (don’t create a bigger mess mid-trip).

c2_jannah_branch_commit.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_branch_commit.title: A Visible Choice
c2_jannah_branch_commit.text:
You stay by Jannah’s side.

You pack, you lift, you carry, you kneel to help a kid with a craft.

Jannah doesn’t look triumphant.

She looks… relieved.

Xin Yi watches quietly.

Later, when the room empties, Xin Yi says:

‘So that’s your choice today.’

choices.text: Tell Xin Yi the truth: ‘Today I needed to show up for her. It doesn’t erase you.’
Avoid explaining (silence as cowardice).

c2_jannah_branch_avoid.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_branch_avoid.title: Trying Not to Choose
c2_jannah_branch_avoid.text:
You split your attention.

You try to be fair.

But people don’t feel loved by fairness.

They feel loved by priority.

Jannah’s warmth becomes quieter.

Xin Yi’s gaze becomes sharper.

And you realize neutrality is also a choice — just not a brave one.

choices.text: Correct course: choose Jannah clearly for the rest of the day.
Correct course: choose Xin Yi clearly and step outside to talk.

c2_xinyi_hard_talk.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_hard_talk.title: No More Half
c2_xinyi_hard_talk.text:
Xin Yi listens.

Then she says something simple:

‘I’m not asking for a relationship today. I’m asking for a direction.’

She leans forward.

‘If you keep pulling me close when you’re lonely, and pushing me away when it gets real… that’s not love. That’s using.’

choices.text: Give direction: ask her to try dating properly, exclusively for one month.
Refuse exclusivity but be honest: you’re not ready (risk losing her).

c2_almah_branch_sincere.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_branch_sincere.title: Intentions
c2_almah_branch_sincere.text:
Almahirah nods once.

No applause.

Just acknowledgement.

‘Then be the kind of man who doesn’t need perfect conditions to do the right thing,’ she says.

You catch the echo of something older — advice she tried to give you back then, when you were too proud to hear it.

As you walk her to the station, you notice the small habits: the way she checks her bag strap, the way she scans the crowd like a nurse scans a ward.

Your phone buzzes.

Kira: ‘We need you tonight. Incident.’

choices.text: Go to Kira (duty), but make a concrete plan with Almahirah first.
Stay with Almahirah (choose the human rhythm).

c2_almah_branch_uncertain.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_branch_uncertain.title: The Honest ‘I Don’t Know’
c2_almah_branch_uncertain.text:
Almahirah doesn’t punish you for uncertainty.

But she doesn’t romanticize it either.

‘Okay,’ she says. ‘Then don’t borrow someone’s heart while you figure yourself out.’

She says it gently — the way you speak to someone you already know will try to wriggle out of responsibility.

For a second, you remember how your relationship ended ten years ago: not with betrayal, but with avoidance.

Her eyes hold you steady.

‘If you’re different now,’ she adds, ‘prove it with clarity.’

choices.text: Commit to clarity: set a decision date (and mean it).
Retreat: keep her out of your uncertainty (self-protective).

c2_dasha_branch_truth.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_branch_truth.title: A Truth That Stays
c2_dasha_branch_truth.text:
Dasha’s smile is small — but real.

‘I don’t want to be a story you tell later,’ she says. ‘I want to be a choice you live.’

That night, she tells you she’s going to Korea next.

Not forever.

But soon.

And she asks:

‘Will you follow, or will you return to your safe life and call it maturity?’

choices.text: Follow (choose the moving horizon).
Return to Singapore (choose stability, accept what it costs).

c2_dasha_branch_pretty.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_branch_pretty.title: Pretty Words
c2_dasha_branch_pretty.text:
Dasha tilts her head.

She doesn’t look disappointed.

She looks warned.

‘People say that,’ she replies. ‘And then they leave.’

She steps half a pace back.

Like she’s already preparing her heart for the shape of your habits.

Later, you see a message from Xin Yi:

‘Can we talk? Properly.’

choices.text: Correct it with Dasha first (show you can stay).
Leave it unresolved and call Xin Yi (pattern repeats).

c2_crossroads.label: Chapter Two
c2_crossroads.title: Crossroads: The Month Leaves a Shape
c2_crossroads.text:
By the end of the month, your choices stop feeling like isolated moments.

They start forming a shape.

Kira’s world rewards competence — and punishes hesitation.
Jannah’s world rewards presence — and punishes vagueness.
Dasha’s world rewards courage — and punishes delay.
Xin Yi’s world rewards consistency — and punishes mixed signals.
Almahirah’s world rewards sincerity — and punishes borrowed hearts.

You feel it now:
• Someone replies slower.
• Someone watches you like a test.
• Someone trusts you more than they should.

Chapter Three begins when two worlds collide in the same place — and you can’t edit the moment after it happens.

choices.text: Start Chapter Three with WORK (a production incident explodes).
Start Chapter Three with FRIENDSHIP (Xin Yi pulls you into a hard truth talk).
Start Chapter Three with HEART (Jannah needs you at her lowest).
Start Chapter Three with FLIGHT (Dasha offers a now-or-never window).
Start Chapter Three with ACCOUNTABILITY (Almahirah tests your word).

c3_work_incident_start.label: Chapter Three
c3_work_incident_start.title: SEV-1
c3_work_incident_start.text:
It happens at 2:17 a.m.

A production incident.
A high-priority client. A system that refuses to heal.

Your phone keeps vibrating until it feels like a pulse.

Kira’s message is short:

‘On. Now.’

You join the bridge call. The room is full of tired voices pretending they’re not afraid.

Kira is calm — but not gentle.

Then, mid-call, another notification flashes:

Jannah.

‘Are you awake?’

Two urgencies.
One night.

And you can’t answer both without consequences.

choices.text: Stay fully on the incident (Kira first).
Step away for 5 minutes to call Jannah (human first).
Text Jannah that you’re busy and will call later (avoidance).

c3_work_hold_line.label: Chapter Three
c3_work_hold_line.title: Holding the Line
c3_work_hold_line.text:
You stay on the bridge call.

You trace the failure. You isolate the blast radius. You propose the fix.

Kira’s voice cuts through the noise.

‘Do it.’

The rollback stabilizes. The graphs settle.

When the call ends, it’s quiet enough to hear your own breathing.

Then the second collision arrives:

Xin Yi’s missed call.

And a new message from Dasha:

‘I’m in Seoul again. One night. If you’re real.’

You’re exhausted.

But Chapter Three doesn’t care.

choices.text: Call Xin Yi first (repair your foundations).
Answer Dasha (rare window, reckless heart).
Sleep and deal with everything later (pattern of delay).

c3_work_jannah_call.label: Chapter Three
c3_work_jannah_call.title: Five Minutes
c3_work_jannah_call.text:
You mute your mic.
You step into the corridor.

Jannah answers immediately.

She doesn’t cry.

That scares you.

‘I’m sorry,’ she says. ‘I shouldn’t have called. I just… I had a parent blow up at me today. And I kept smiling until it hurt.’

You hear her inhale.

‘Are you okay?’ you ask.

There’s silence.

Then she whispers:

‘I wanted to hear a voice that feels safe.’

Your work phone buzzes.
Kira: ‘Where are you?’

choices.text: Tell Jannah you’ll come over after the incident ends (promise + plan).
End the call quickly and return to Kira (duty first).
Stay longer with Jannah and risk Kira’s wrath (human first).

c3_kira_notice_absence.label: Chapter Three
c3_kira_notice_absence.title: Kira Notices
c3_kira_notice_absence.text:
When you return, Kira doesn’t shout.

She doesn’t need to.

Her silence is surgical.

‘You left the bridge,’ she says.

You start to explain.

Kira raises a hand.

‘If you can’t handle this role, say it now.’

Then — like the universe loves timing — Xin Yi texts:

‘I saw your status. Are you okay?’

Three people.
One failure point.

Choose the kind of man you are under pressure.

choices.text: Own it to Kira: apologize, recommit, finish the SEV properly.
Set a boundary with Kira (risky): ‘I can do my job and still be human.’
Ignore Kira’s mood and text Xin Yi back first (dangerous optics).

c3_kira_boundary_fight.label: Chapter Three
c3_kira_boundary_fight.title: Boundary Fire
c3_kira_boundary_fight.text:
Kira’s expression tightens.

‘Human is fine,’ she says. ‘Unreliable is not.’

Then, quieter:

‘If you want this job — if you want my trust — you don’t disappear.’

You hear what she’s not saying.

She doesn’t like needing anyone.

And she needed you.

Outside, dawn begins to thin the sky.

Your phone buzzes.

Almahirah: ‘Did you keep your word this week?’

choices.text: De-escalate with Kira and focus on repair (work trust).
Message Almahirah immediately with clarity (accountability).

c3_xinyi_truth_start.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_truth_start.title: No More Comfort-Lies
c3_xinyi_truth_start.text:
Xin Yi meets you somewhere neutral — a café that doesn’t hold memories.

She sits across from you like she’s deciding whether to stay in your life.

‘I’m not angry,’ she says.

Then she adds:

‘I’m done being confused.’

She slides her phone across the table.

A screenshot.

You with Kira.

It’s not romantic in the photo.

But it’s close.

And closeness has consequences.

As you reach for words, your phone rings.

Kira.

‘We need you. Now.’

choices.text: Stay with Xin Yi and finish the hard talk (choose personal clarity).
Go to Kira immediately (choose career reality).
Ask Xin Yi to come with you (collision): ‘Don’t leave. Walk with me.’

c3_xinyi_finish_talk.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_finish_talk.title: Direction
c3_xinyi_finish_talk.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t ask for poetry.

She asks for direction.

‘Am I a choice,’ she says, ‘or am I the person you keep warm while you decide?’

Your throat tightens.

This is the truth you can’t optimize.

It can only be spoken.

Outside the café window, you see someone enter.

Jannah.

She wasn’t supposed to be here.

She freezes when she sees you.

And now you have to choose what you do in overlapping spaces.

choices.text: Go after Jannah immediately (repair + concern).
Stay with Xin Yi and finish (consistency).
Call out to Jannah but don’t leave (balanced, risky).

c3_xinyi_walk_and_call.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_walk_and_call.title: Walk With Me
c3_xinyi_walk_and_call.text:
Xin Yi hesitates.

Then she stands.

Not because she’s okay.

Because she’s giving you a final chance to be real.

You answer Kira’s call while walking.

‘Where are you?’ Kira asks.

You swallow.

‘I’m handling something personal. I’ll join in thirty.’

The silence on the line is sharp.

‘Don’t make it a habit,’ Kira says.

Xin Yi hears it.

And her expression changes.

Because now she understands what she’s up against.

choices.text: Choose Xin Yi properly: turn off your work phone for 30 minutes.
Choose Kira’s reality: keep the phone on, half-present (bad habit).

c3_xinyi_exclusive_offer.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_exclusive_offer.title: One Month, Properly
c3_xinyi_exclusive_offer.text:
Xin Yi’s eyes don’t soften.

She doesn’t want a speech.

She wants proof.

She says, very quietly:

‘If you want me, choose me like you mean it.’

Your mind runs through calendars and consequences.

Then you realize:

This is the point of the story.

Not choosing perfectly.

Choosing honestly.

choices.text: Offer exclusivity for one month (clean direction).
Refuse exclusivity but be honest (risk losing her).

c3_jannah_need_start.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_need_start.title: The Day She Stops Smiling
c3_jannah_need_start.text:
Jannah calls you after work.

Her voice is controlled.

‘Can I see you?’

You arrive and realize she hasn’t been sleeping.

She sits with her hands folded like she’s trying to keep herself contained.

‘A parent filed a complaint,’ she says. ‘It’s being escalated.’

She laughs once.

It’s not humor.

‘And I kept thinking… if I disappear, would anyone notice?’

Your phone buzzes.

Kira: ‘We have a deployment review. Get online.’

choices.text: Stay with Jannah (choose presence).
Go online for Kira but keep Jannah on speaker (half-present).
Ask Xin Yi to come too (collision support).

c3_dasha_window_start.label: Chapter Three
c3_dasha_window_start.title: One Night Only
c3_dasha_window_start.text:
Dasha’s message doesn’t beg.

It challenges.

‘Seoul. One night. If you’re real.’

You stare at the screen.

Your life is Singapore.
Your job is Kira.
Your stability is carefully built.

And Dasha is the kind of person who makes stability feel like fear.

As you hesitate, Almahirah messages:

‘Did you keep your word this week?’

choices.text: Choose Dasha: book the flight (now-or-never).
Choose Almahirah: reply with accountability and stay grounded.
Choose work: tell yourself travel is childish (avoidance dressed as maturity).

c3_almah_word_start.label: Chapter Three
c3_almah_word_start.title: Keep Your Word
c3_almah_word_start.text:
Almahirah doesn’t chase.

She invites.

Then she watches whether you keep your word.

You told her you’d show up.

Now it’s Friday.

You arrive after her class, and for a second the decade folds — the same kind of meeting, the same kind of quiet, except you’re older and the excuses are thinner.

She looks at you, tired but calm.

‘You came,’ she says.

Then, as if to test the foundation — not just of today, but of what you failed to build ten years ago:

‘Tell me about the others.’

No jealousy.

Just sincerity.

And sincerity is more dangerous than anger, especially from an ex who met you again in Mecca and still chose to be fair.

choices.text: Tell the truth fully (risk losing her, earn respect).
Give a partial truth (safer, but shaky).
Refuse to discuss them (boundary, but may read as hiding).

c3_xinyi_midnight_call.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_midnight_call.title: Midnight Repair
c3_xinyi_midnight_call.text:
Xin Yi picks up.

She doesn’t sound angry.

That scares you.

‘I’m tired,’ she says. ‘Not of you. Of uncertainty.’

She pauses.

‘Tell me the truth. If I stopped replying tomorrow… would you fight for me or would you adapt?’

choices.text: Fight: set a concrete plan (date/time) and keep it.
Adapt: say you understand if she needs space (cowardice disguised as respect).

c3_morning_fallout.label: Chapter Three
c3_morning_fallout.title: The Cost of Delay
c3_morning_fallout.text:
Morning arrives with consequences.

A seen message with no reply.

A missed call that doesn’t repeat.

A warmth that doesn’t return.

You realize something terrifying:

You don’t lose people all at once.

You lose them in fractions.

Chapter Three continues — and it won’t be gentle.

choices.text: Double down on work (hide inside competence).
Repair one bond today (choose who you refuse to lose).

c3_repair_picker.label: Chapter Three
c3_repair_picker.title: Repair Picker
c3_repair_picker.text:
You can’t repair everyone at once.

Pick one person and do it properly — not with a vague apology, but with action.

choices.text: Repair Xin Yi (clarity + plan).
Repair Jannah (presence).
Repair Dasha (courage).
Repair Almahirah (accountability).
Repair Kira (work trust).

c3_kira_repair_work_trust.label: Chapter Three
c3_kira_repair_work_trust.title: Repairing Trust at Work
c3_kira_repair_work_trust.text:
You show up early.

You prepare the post-mortem.
You document the timeline.
You own your mistakes.

Kira reads silently.

Then she says:

‘This is what trust looks like.’

She pauses.

‘Don’t make me regret giving it.’

choices.text: Keep it professional (safe).
Let it become personal (dangerous).

c3_next_chapter_gate.label: Chapter Three
c3_next_chapter_gate.title: End of Chapter Three
c3_next_chapter_gate.text:
Chapter Three ends with a simple truth:

You can’t optimize love.

You can only choose — and pay the price of what you didn’t choose.

Chapter Four will escalate the collisions.

choices.text: Continue to Chapter Four.

c2_xinyi_crossover_from_kira.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_crossover_from_kira.title: A Promised Night
c2_xinyi_crossover_from_kira.text:
You meet Xin Yi with your phone face-down for once.

She notices the effort. Then she asks the only question that matters: 'Is this a habit, or a direction?'

choices.text: Give her a concrete plan (date, time, and priority).
Keep it vague (protect yourself).

c2_xinyi_crossover_from_jannah.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_crossover_from_jannah.title: Private Corner
c2_xinyi_crossover_from_jannah.text:
Xin Yi pulls you aside from the charity day crowd.

'I'm not here to compete,' she says. 'I'm here to understand what you keep refusing to name.'

choices.text: Be honest: ask for one proper conversation after this event.
Deflect: say you're just stressed lately.

c2_xinyi_plan_lock.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_plan_lock.title: Plan, Not Apology
c2_xinyi_plan_lock.text:
You stop speaking in feelings and start speaking in action.

A date. A time. A clear promise.

Xin Yi exhales—like she was holding her breath for weeks.

Then your work phone lights up: Kira needs you in the war room.

choices.text: Go to Kira after you lock the plan (both matter, but keep your word).
Delay the war room by 15 minutes to finish this properly (risk).

c2_xinyi_distance.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_distance.title: Distance
c2_xinyi_distance.text:
Xin Yi doesn't block you.

She just becomes... quieter.

'I'm not angry,' she says. 'I'm adjusting my expectations.'

That sentence is a door moving.

choices.text: Chase clarity: ask her what she needs to stay.
Let her go for now (avoid conflict).

c2_xinyi_after_charity.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_after_charity.title: After the Charity Day
c2_xinyi_after_charity.text:
After the kids go home, the noise fades.

Xin Yi and Jannah both linger—two different kinds of warmth in the same hallway.

They don't force you.

They watch what you do.

choices.text: Walk Jannah to her car (choose presence).
Walk Xin Yi to the train (choose clarity).

c2_xinyi_repair_scene.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_repair_scene.title: Repair, Not Excuse
c2_xinyi_repair_scene.text:
You follow Xin Yi through Seoul streets until she finally stops.

'If you're going to apologize,' she says, 'do it with truth.'

choices.text: Tell her everything (messy but real).
Ask for time and space (risk losing her).

c2_xinyi_exclusive_month.label: Chapter Two
c2_xinyi_exclusive_month.title: One Month, One Direction
c2_xinyi_exclusive_month.text:
Xin Yi doesn't ask for forever.

She asks for one month of consistency—no mixed signals, no half-dates, no emotional borrowing.

If you agree, your other bonds will notice.

choices.text: Agree to one month exclusive (high gain, high cost).
Refuse exclusivity but stay honest (lower intensity).

c2_kira_boundary_talk.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_boundary_talk.title: Lines You Can't Unsee
c2_kira_boundary_talk.text:
Back at the hotel, Kira speaks without softness.

'If this becomes messy, it ends your career faster than it ends your feelings.'

It isn't jealousy. It's reality.

She waits to see if you understand.

choices.text: Reassure her professionally: you won't compromise the work.
Admit it's already personal (dangerous honesty).

c2_kira_week2.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_week2.title: Week Two: Consequences
c2_kira_week2.text:
Avoidance doesn't erase problems—it schedules them.

By week two, the incident backlog, the unread messages, and the emotional debt all arrive together.

choices.text: Pick one person to repair properly.
Hide inside work again (temporary relief).

c2_kira_explain_dasha.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_explain_dasha.title: Explaining Without Lying
c2_kira_explain_dasha.text:
Kira listens as you explain why you stepped out.

She doesn't ask who Dasha is.

She asks whether you can still be reliable.

choices.text: Recommit to the trip and deliver (earn it).
Ask for one night off (risky pattern).

c2_dasha_night.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_night.title: Neon Honesty
c2_dasha_night.text:
Dasha takes you somewhere quiet—away from the hotel, away from the roles.

'No performance,' she says. 'Tell me what you really are.'

choices.text: Be real (courage).
Keep it romantic but evasive (safe).

c2_dasha_repair.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_repair.title: If You're Real
c2_dasha_repair.text:
Dasha doesn't want promises.

She wants proof—small choices that cost you something.

choices.text: Offer to meet again in Sapa or Seoul—set a date.
Admit you can't live that way (stability).

c2_dasha_follow_korea.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_follow_korea.title: Following the Horizon
c2_dasha_follow_korea.text:
You choose movement.

It feels brave, and it feels irresponsible.

Either way: it's a decision.

choices.text: Return to Singapore and face the fallout.
Tell Kira early (integrity).

c2_dasha_return_sg.label: Chapter Two
c2_dasha_return_sg.title: Returning Home
c2_dasha_return_sg.text:
You choose stability.

Dasha nods like she expected it.

The goodbye is gentle—but it stays in your ribs.

choices.text: Message her after you land (keep the thread).
Let it end cleanly (no half-threads).

c2_jannah_stay.label: Chapter Two
c2_jannah_stay.title: Staying
c2_jannah_stay.text:
You stay with Jannah until her shoulders unclench.

She doesn't ask for romance.

She just lets you be a safe place, and that is intimacy of its own.

choices.text: Make breakfast plans (presence continues).
Text Kira to warn you'll be late (responsible).

c2_kira_incident_from_jannah.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_incident_from_jannah.title: Incident Response
c2_kira_incident_from_jannah.text:
You leave Jannah's place and enter the war room.

Kira doesn't scold you in front of the team.

She just watches whether you can still perform.

choices.text: Perform flawlessly (earn back trust).
Make a mistake (fatigue costs you).

c2_kira_incident_from_almah.label: Chapter Two
c2_kira_incident_from_almah.title: Duty vs Discipline
c2_kira_incident_from_almah.text:
You promised Almahirah sincerity.

Now Kira wants you on-call.

And your life tests whether your words were real.

choices.text: Go to Kira but message Almahirah with a clear plan.
Skip the incident (choose Almahirah's rhythm).

c2_almah_stay.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_stay.title: Choosing the Human Rhythm
c2_almah_stay.text:
You stay.

Not to chase romance — to honor the moment.

Almahirah walks beside you in quiet steps, as if silence is also a language you once shared.

‘Back then,’ she says without looking at you, ‘we had feelings. But we didn’t have discipline.’

She finally meets your eyes.

‘So tell me the truth. Are you here to fix… or to repeat?’

choices.text: Ask to see her again next week (consistency).
Keep it quiet and private (protective).

c2_almah_decision_date.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_decision_date.title: A Decision Date
c2_almah_decision_date.text:
You choose a date.

Not a romantic gesture — a boundary.

Almahirah watches you like she’s assessing vitals: not your charm, but your follow-through.

‘Good,’ she says. ‘Then don’t make me chase a decision I didn’t ask for.’

She turns, and the sentence that follows is almost too quiet:

‘We already lost ten years once. Don’t waste another season.’

choices.text: Tell the others you're slowing down (clarity).
Keep it to yourself (cowardly).

c2_almah_distance.label: Chapter Two
c2_almah_distance.title: No Borrowed Hearts
c2_almah_distance.text:
You step back.

You call it restraint.

But Almahirah reads it as what it often is: fear dressed as politeness.

She doesn’t argue. She doesn’t beg.

She only nods — a closure you didn’t give her a decade ago, returned to you with mercy.

‘Take care,’ she says.

And for the first time, you wonder if “taking care” was always the point.

choices.text: Come back honestly (repair).
Don't. Not yet.

c3_xinyi_month_rules.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_month_rules.title: Rules of One Month
c3_xinyi_month_rules.text:
One month exclusive sounds simple.

Then reality hits: work escalations, unexpected travel, and people who still have feelings for you.

Xin Yi asks for one thing: consistency under pressure.

choices.text: Invite Xin Yi into your schedule (share calendar, be transparent).
Try to manage it alone (secrecy as control).

c3_xinyi_plan_lock.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_plan_lock.title: A Plan That Holds
c3_xinyi_plan_lock.text:
You send Xin Yi a real plan: nights you are free, weekends you will protect, and what you will stop doing.

She replies with one word: 'Okay.'

Then a new collision arrives: Kira wants a late coffee to debrief.

choices.text: Decline Kira and keep your plan with Xin Yi (boundary).
Accept Kira's coffee but tell Xin Yi immediately (transparency).

c3_xinyi_distance_lock.label: Chapter Three
c3_xinyi_distance_lock.title: Distance, Locked
c3_xinyi_distance_lock.text:
Xin Yi doesn't argue.

She just becomes formal.

When a person stops fighting, it means they are considering leaving.

choices.text: Repair now (show up in person).
Double down on work (avoid the feeling).

c3_dasha_midnight_risk.label: Chapter Three
c3_dasha_midnight_risk.title: Midnight Risk
c3_dasha_midnight_risk.text:
Dasha's window is small.

You could fly. You could lie. You could pretend you're still the brave version of yourself.

Or you could admit you're afraid.

choices.text: Go to Seoul (reckless courage).
Don't go—but tell Dasha the truth (integrity).

c3_jannah_after_incident_promise.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_after_incident_promise.title: After the Incident
c3_jannah_after_incident_promise.text:
When the graphs finally settle, you remember your promise.

You call Jannah back—properly this time.

choices.text: Go over now (presence).
Schedule tomorrow morning (still trying to be balanced).

c3_jannah_hold_her_world.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_hold_her_world.title: Holding Her World
c3_jannah_hold_her_world.text:
Jannah lets you sit in her quiet living room, where she can finally stop performing.

She doesn't ask you to fix her life.

She asks you to stay.

choices.text: Stay fully (choose her, for tonight).
Leave early to handle work/others (half-present).

c3_jannah_half_present.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_half_present.title: Half-Present
c3_jannah_half_present.text:
You try to be everything to everyone.

Jannah hears it in the way your attention keeps slipping.

choices.text: Apologize and put your phone away (commit).
Make an excuse and leave (damage).

c3_jannah_walkout.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_walkout.title: The Door
c3_jannah_walkout.text:
Jannah opens the door for you.

Not angrily.

Just quietly.

'Come back when you can be here,' she says.

choices.text: Repair Jannah properly next (action).
Run to work (escape).

c3_jannah_xinyi_support.label: Chapter Three
c3_jannah_xinyi_support.title: Two Kinds of Warmth
c3_jannah_xinyi_support.text:
Xin Yi calls while you're with Jannah.

Not to accuse.

To check whether you're okay.

Your life is now overlapping in real time.

choices.text: Be transparent: tell Xin Yi you're with Jannah and why.
Hide it (short-term peace, long-term cost).

c3_almah_accountability_reply.label: Chapter Three
c3_almah_accountability_reply.title: Accountability Reply
c3_almah_accountability_reply.text:
You type slowly.

Because with Almahirah, you’ve learned that quick replies can still be dishonest.

You tell her the truth: what you kept, what you didn’t, where you failed.

There’s a pause before her reply comes.

‘Thank you for not lying,’ she says.

Then, softer — a line that feels like Mecca air in your lungs:

‘Fate brought us back. Don’t make me regret that.’

choices.text: Meet her after shift (show up).
Ask for another day (risk).

c3_almah_full_truth.label: Chapter Three
c3_almah_full_truth.title: Full Truth
c3_almah_full_truth.text:
You tell the truth fully.

Not to cleanse yourself.

To respect her.

You speak about each girl without insulting any of them — and without hiding your own cowardice.

Almahirah listens, eyes steady, like a nurse listening to symptoms.

When you finish, she exhales — not relief, not heartbreak, something older.

‘You know what hurt ten years ago?’ she says quietly. ‘Not that you left. That you left without honesty.’

She looks at you.

‘If you’ve learned anything since then, prove it here. Don’t make Mecca your reset button and Singapore your relapse.’

choices.text: Accept her counsel and choose a clearer path.
Ask her to stay anyway (vulnerable request).

c3_almah_partial_truth.label: Chapter Three
c3_almah_partial_truth.title: Partial Truth
c3_almah_partial_truth.text:
You give a partial truth.

Enough to look transparent.

Not enough to be clean.

Almahirah doesn’t interrupt. She just… watches the gaps.

When you stop, she nods slowly.

‘You’re still doing it,’ she says. ‘Managing the story instead of telling the truth.’

Her voice doesn’t rise.

That makes it worse.

‘Ten years ago, that’s how we ended,’ she adds. ‘I won’t repeat that ending with you.’

choices.text: Correct yourself immediately (integrity).
Hold the line (pride).

c3_almah_boundary.label: Chapter Three
c3_almah_boundary.title: Boundary of Principle
c3_almah_boundary.text:
You set a boundary.

‘I don’t want to discuss them,’ you say.

Almahirah considers that with surprising calm.

‘A boundary is fine,’ she replies. ‘But hiding is not a boundary.’

She tilts her head.

‘If you want to be a man of integrity, you don’t get to ask for my peace while keeping your secrets.’

The old relationship would have turned this into a fight.

This time, she simply waits — to see who you choose to be.

choices.text: Respect the boundary and repair later with action.
Walk away (lose the thread).

c3_kira_personal_edge.label: Chapter Three
c3_kira_personal_edge.title: Personal Edge
c3_kira_personal_edge.text:
Kira's tone changes—subtle, dangerous.

'If this is going to be personal,' she says, 'then be honest about what you're risking.'

She isn't asking for romance.

She's asking whether you understand consequences.

choices.text: Keep it professional (protect both of you).
Admit you want more (reckless).

c3_cafe_triangle.label: Chapter Three
c3_cafe_triangle.title: The Same Café
c3_cafe_triangle.text:
The collision is almost comical.

A late café. A quiet corner. One wrong glance.

You arrive, and within minutes—someone else walks in.

Not on purpose.

Just life.

Tonight forces a visible choice.

choices.text: Leave first with the person who was here first (honor priority).
Stay and face everyone honestly (high tension, high integrity).
Escape (lie, excuse, vanish).

ending_gate.label: Finale
ending_gate.title: Finale: What You Earned
ending_gate.text:
The story tightens into a single point.

Not a punishment.
Not a reward.

A result.

The night you stopped being vague changed the shape of every bond.

Now the finale doesn’t ask what you *feel*.

It asks what you’ve proven:

• Affection — did love grow?
• Trust — did you become safe?
• Tension — did you keep the room from burning?

Take one breath.

Then step forward and let the ending choose you back.

choices.text: See the ending I earned.

ending.label: Finale
ending.title: Epilogue: The After
ending.text:
After the choice, life continues.

Work still demands.
Flights still leave.
Faith still asks you to be accountable.
Friendship still remembers.

But you’re no longer living five versions of yourself.

You’re living one.

And the person you chose—or lost—will be the proof of what you became.

choices.text: Restart from the Prologue.

c4_start.label: Chapter Four
c4_start.title: The Week After
c4_start.text:
The week after the collisions, your life tries to return to routine.

But routine is where consequences live.

Kira messages you first — not as a boss, but as a person who noticed you stayed late again.

Jannah posts a photo of her class: tiny hands holding paper hearts. No caption. Just proof she keeps showing up.

Dasha sends you a voice note from somewhere windy — Sapa again, or maybe somewhere else entirely. Her laughter is brief, like a match struck in fog.

Xin Yi doesn’t text. Which is its own kind of message.

Almahirah does. A simple line: “Did you pray? Did you sleep?”

Five threads. One mind. One heart pretending it can multitask.

Tonight, you have to choose who gets your *real* attention — not your leftovers.

choices.text: Meet Kira after work (1-on-1).
Check on Jannah after her preschool shift (1-on-1).
Call Dasha (she's on the road in Sapa).
Show up for Xin Yi without warning (1-on-1).
Meet Almahirah at the mosque after Maghrib (1-on-1).
Do nothing — hide in work again (the coward’s choice).

c4_kira_meet.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_meet.title: Kira: After Hours
c4_kira_meet.text:
Kira chooses a quiet place — not romantic, not sterile. Somewhere between.

She sits across from you with her sleeves rolled, hair tied, the same controlled presence that makes meetings feel like trials.

But tonight, she doesn’t open with metrics.

“You’ve been… louder,” she says softly. “Not in your mouth. In your life.”

She taps the table once, like a clock.

“Tell me the truth. Are you spiraling — or are you finally being honest?”

choices.text: Be honest: you don’t know what you’re doing, but you’re trying.
Deflect into competence: talk about work, incident follow-ups, plans.
Cross the line: admit you think about her outside work (dangerous).

c4_kira_honest.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_honest.title: Kira: The Cost of Honesty
c4_kira_honest.text:
You tell her the simplest true thing:

“I’m not proud of how many people I’m keeping in motion.”

Kira doesn’t flinch. She just watches, assessing the difference between confession and manipulation.

Then she nods once.

“Good. Because the worst version of you is the one who convinces himself he’s being ‘efficient’ while he’s actually avoiding.”

Her voice lowers.

“If you want me in your life, it has to be clean. No hidden chaos.”

choices.text: Choose clean: tell Kira you will stop letting work be your excuse.
Ask for time: you can’t promise clean yet, but you won’t lie.
End the night politely and leave (protect boundaries).

c4_kira_deflect.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_deflect.title: Kira: Deflection
c4_kira_deflect.text:
You talk about timelines, mitigation, next steps.

Kira lets you finish.

Then she says, “You do that when you’re scared.”

A pause.

“Don’t turn me into another problem to solve.”

Her gaze softens — only slightly.

“Go. Fix your life before it reaches my desk.”

choices.text: Swallow pride and apologize (show you heard her).
Leave quickly (avoid intimacy).

c4_kira_edge.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_edge.title: Kira: The Edge
c4_kira_edge.text:
The air shifts when you say it.

Not romance. Not confession.

Just the truth that she exists in your head when she’s not in your calendar.

Kira’s eyes narrow — not angry, but careful.

“Then understand what you’re asking for,” she says.

“Because if this becomes real, it becomes *expensive*.”

Her phone buzzes. She doesn’t look at it.

“Are you willing to pay — or are you just chasing dopamine?”

choices.text: Pay the price: tell her you’ll make choices, not excuses.
Back off: tell her you respect the boundary and won’t blur work.
Hesitate (and she notices).

c4_kira_hesitate.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_hesitate.title: Kira: The Look
c4_kira_hesitate.text:
Kira doesn’t argue.

She just gives you a look that feels like a closed door.

“Go,” she says. “Before you make this uglier.”

And you leave with the sick understanding that some people don’t get hurt loudly.

They just stop opening the door.

choices.text: Text her later with clarity (repair attempt).
Don’t text. Accept the distance.

c4_kira_clean_promise.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_clean_promise.title: Kira: Clean Promise
c4_kira_clean_promise.text:
You tell her you’ll do something real: you’ll stop letting proximity replace commitment.

Kira listens.

Then she says, “Show me.”

Not tomorrow. Not as a speech.

As an action.

On your way out, you see a message lighting your screen:

Xin Yi: “Are you free right now?”

The night is already trying to split you again.

choices.text: Go to Xin Yi immediately (prove you can keep friendships real too).
Stay with Kira and finish this conversation properly.
Tell Xin Yi you’ll call later and go home alone.

c4_kira_time_request.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_time_request.title: Kira: Time Request
c4_kira_time_request.text:
You tell her you can’t promise a clean life overnight — but you can promise you won’t lie.

Kira nods.

“That’s the first adult thing you’ve said.”

Then she stands.

“You have one job, then. Don’t make your confusion someone else’s trauma.”

You walk out into the night with your phone heavy in your pocket.

choices.text: Call Jannah (check if she’s okay).
Call Dasha (risk the impulsive).
Go home and sleep (choose stability).

c4_kira_apology.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_apology.title: Kira: Apology
c4_kira_apology.text:
“I’m sorry,” you say. “I keep hiding inside work because it’s the only place I feel competent.”

Kira exhales — almost a laugh.

“That’s honest.”

Then, softer:

“Don’t confuse competence with intimacy.”

She taps the table again, once.

“Go choose someone. Properly.”

choices.text: Choose someone properly (move to the night’s crossroads).

c4_kira_price.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_price.title: Kira: The Price
c4_kira_price.text:
You tell her you’re willing to pay the price: clarity, boundaries, consequences.

Kira studies you.

Then she leans back and finally checks her phone.

“Good,” she says. “Because if you slip, I won’t chase. I’ll cut.”

It isn’t cruelty.

It’s self-respect.

As you leave, your screen lights again: a missed call from Jannah.

choices.text: Call Jannah back immediately (presence).
Message Jannah to meet tomorrow (delay).
Ignore it and call Dasha (impulse).

c4_kira_stay_finish.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_stay_finish.title: Kira: Finish Properly
c4_kira_stay_finish.text:
You silence your phone.

Kira notices.

That small act lands like a vow.

“Alright,” she says. “Then listen.”

She lays out boundaries like terms of a treaty:
• No ambiguity.
• No late-night emotional borrowing.
• No using her authority as a thrill.

“If you want me,” she says, “you choose me. Not in secret.”

The sentence is a knife and a key.

choices.text: Agree — and feel the weight of what you just promised.
Admit you can’t agree yet (honest refusal).

c4_xinyi_after_kira.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_after_kira.title: Xin Yi: The Friend Who Waited
c4_xinyi_after_kira.text:
Xin Yi answers on the second ring.

She doesn’t sound angry.

She sounds tired.

“Where are you?” she asks.

When you tell her, she’s quiet. Then:

“Come over. Just… as my friend. I need to say something without performing.”

choices.text: Go now (1-on-1, no excuses).
Ask what’s wrong first (careful distance).
Suggest meeting tomorrow (delay).

c4_jannah_meet.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_meet.title: Jannah: After the Last Child Leaves
c4_jannah_meet.text:
The preschool is quiet after 6 p.m.

Jannah sits on a tiny chair meant for children, rubbing her eyes like she’s been holding the whole day inside her ribs.

When she sees you, she smiles — small, grateful.

“You came,” she says. “I didn’t want to ask. But… I wanted you to.”

She hands you a paper heart a kid made.

“It’s stupid,” she says. “But today felt heavy.”

choices.text: Sit with her and be fully present (no phone).
Ask her to talk while you walk her home (gentle).
Try to cheer her up with jokes (avoid depth).

c4_jannah_present.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_present.title: Jannah: Presence
c4_jannah_present.text:
You sit. You listen.

Jannah talks about the kid who cried for his mum all morning.
The parent who forgot pickup.
The teacher who snapped.

Then she stops, embarrassed.

“Sorry. I sound like I’m complaining.”

You shake your head.

“No. You sound like someone who keeps showing up.”

Her eyes shine.

“You always know the right words,” she whispers. “Do you ever get tired of being the one who fixes things?”

choices.text: Admit you’re tired (vulnerable truth).
Reassure her you’re fine (protect yourself).
Hold her hand briefly (tender, but risky).

c4_jannah_walk_home.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_walk_home.title: Jannah: Walk Home
c4_jannah_walk_home.text:
Outside, the air is cooler.

Jannah walks slowly, like she’s buying time.

“I heard you’ve been… busy,” she says carefully.

Not accusing. Just observing.

“And I don’t want to be someone you keep around because I’m safe.”

She looks at you.

“Do you ever think about choosing just one person?”

choices.text: Tell her you’ve thought about it — and it scares you.
Tell her you’re not ready to choose (honest).
Change the subject (cowardice).

c4_jannah_joke.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_joke.title: Jannah: The Smile That Doesn't Land
c4_jannah_joke.text:
You try to lighten it.

Jannah laughs — politely.

But her eyes don’t.

After a moment she says, “It’s okay. You don’t have to do this if you don’t want to.”

And suddenly you realize:

For her, affection isn’t loud.

It’s a door.

And you’re teaching her to close it.

choices.text: Stop joking and apologize; be real now.
Let the moment pass (distance grows).

c4_jannah_vulnerable.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_vulnerable.title: Jannah: You Too?
c4_jannah_vulnerable.text:
You tell her you’re tired.

Not of her.

Of yourself.

Jannah reaches out and touches your wrist like a grounding.

“Then stop pretending you can carry everyone,” she says gently.

Her phone buzzes — a message from Xin Yi asking if she’s free tonight.

Jannah doesn’t open it.

She waits for what you’ll do.

choices.text: Ask Jannah to stay with you a little longer (choose her).
Tell her you should check on Xin Yi too (balance attempt).
End the night respectfully; let her rest (care).

c4_jannah_reassure.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_reassure.title: Jannah: Reassurance
c4_jannah_reassure.text:
You tell her you’re okay.

Jannah nods — but it feels like she’s accepting a script, not a truth.

“Okay,” she says.

That’s all.

But her smile is smaller when she says it.

choices.text: Correct it: admit you lied and open up.
Leave it as is (safe, but colder).

c4_jannah_hand.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_hand.title: Jannah: Tender Risk
c4_jannah_hand.text:
Your fingers find hers.

Jannah freezes for half a second, then relaxes like a person finally allowed to be held.

She doesn’t move closer.

She just stays.

And that stillness feels like faith.

Your phone lights up with a call from Kira.

The table, the touch, the ringing — a triangle you created.

choices.text: Ignore the call and stay present with Jannah.
Answer Kira (work boundary, but it will hurt).
Silence it and end the night gently (avoid conflict).

c4_jannah_stay.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_stay.title: Jannah: Stay
c4_jannah_stay.text:
You stay.

You talk until the sky darkens fully.

Jannah’s voice gets softer. Less teacher. More woman.

Before you leave, she says, “If you choose me one day… don’t choose me because I’m easy.”

Then she smiles.

“Choose me because you’re ready.”

choices.text: Promise you’ll be ready soon (hope).
Don’t promise — just thank her (honesty).

c4_jannah_choice_fear.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_choice_fear.title: Jannah: Fear of Choosing
c4_jannah_choice_fear.text:
You admit that choosing scares you.

Jannah nods like she expected it.

“Because choosing means losing,” she says.

“And you’re the kind of person who hates being the villain in someone’s story.”

She looks at you carefully.

“But sometimes you become the villain anyway — just slower.”

choices.text: Ask her what she would do in your place (humility).
Tell her you’ll start cutting confusion starting tonight (action).
Get defensive (ego).

c4_jannah_advice.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_advice.title: Jannah: Advice
c4_jannah_advice.text:
Jannah thinks for a long moment.

“Choose the person you become better for,” she says.

“Not the person who makes you feel most alive for five minutes.”

Then she adds, barely audible:

“And choose the person you can still love when you’re tired.”

choices.text: Hold onto her words and go to the crossroads.
Ask if she’s talking about herself (dangerous directness).

c4_jannah_self.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_self.title: Jannah: Quiet Yes
c4_jannah_self.text:
Jannah doesn’t blush.

She just looks at you with the kind of honesty that’s rare.

“I’m talking about what I know,” she says.

“And what I know is… I’d love you even when you’re tired.”

It isn’t a confession.

It’s a fact.

And facts are heavier.

choices.text: Thank her and leave gently (protect her heart).
Stay a little longer (choose her tonight).

c4_jannah_not_ready.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_not_ready.title: Jannah: Not Ready
c4_jannah_not_ready.text:
You tell her you’re not ready to choose.

Jannah nods.

“I don’t want a promise,” she says.

“I want a direction.”

Then she smiles, tired.

“Go figure it out. I’ll still be kind. But I won’t be stupid.”

choices.text: Respect the boundary and leave.
Ask her to give you a month (exclusive trial).

c4_jannah_exclusive_month.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_exclusive_month.title: Jannah: A Month
c4_jannah_exclusive_month.text:
“A month,” you say. “Just you. No confusion.”

Jannah studies you like a teacher evaluating sincerity.

Then she nods once.

“Okay,” she says.

But her eyes say: *Don’t waste this.*

choices.text: Commit to the month (raise stakes).
Second-guess immediately (she sees it).

c4_kira_interrupt_call.label: Chapter Four
c4_kira_interrupt_call.title: Kira: The Call You Answered
c4_kira_interrupt_call.text:
You answer.

Kira’s voice is calm, professional.

But there’s a pause — like she registered the background silence, the timing, the choice.

“Never mind,” she says. “Handle what you’re handling.”

Then she hangs up.

Jannah doesn’t say anything.

But her hand slips out of yours.

choices.text: Apologize to Jannah and explain (damage control).
Chase Kira with a message (panic).
Say nothing and end the night (avoid).

c4_xinyi_after_jannah.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_after_jannah.title: Xin Yi: The Message You Don't Ignore
c4_xinyi_after_jannah.text:
You walk Jannah to her car.

Then you text Xin Yi: “I’m coming.”

She replies instantly: “Good.”

When you arrive, she’s waiting downstairs like she didn’t trust you to show.

She doesn’t hug you.

She just says, “Upstairs. No distractions.”

choices.text: Go up and listen (1-on-1).
Ask to talk downstairs instead (public safety).
Say you’re too tired tonight (back out).

c4_dasha_call.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_call.title: Dasha: Wind in the Mic
c4_dasha_call.text:
Dasha answers on video.

The background is moving — a car window, mountain road, streetlights smeared by rain.

“Hello, Singapore boy,” she says, grinning. “Are you alive?”

Her eyes are bright in a way that always feels like a dare.

“You’re quiet lately,” she says. “Did you become boring?”

She laughs.

Then, softer: “Or did you finally get hurt?”

choices.text: Tell her you got hurt (truth).
Flirt and keep it light (avoid depth).
Ask where she is and why she keeps running (challenge).

c4_dasha_hurt.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_hurt.title: Dasha: Hurt
c4_dasha_hurt.text:
You tell her you got hurt.

Dasha goes quiet.

Then she nods — like she respects pain more than confidence.

“Okay,” she says. “Then don’t lie to yourself.”

A beat.

“I’m in Sapa,” she admits. “But I’m leaving soon. Korea, maybe. Or somewhere colder.”

She watches you through the screen.

“Tell me you’ll come. Or tell me you won’t. I hate maybes.”

choices.text: Tell her you'll come (impulse, high risk).
Tell her you can't (honesty, but it will sting).
Ask for one more call first (delay).

c4_dasha_flirt.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_flirt.title: Dasha: Pretty and Empty
c4_dasha_flirt.text:
You flirt.

Dasha laughs.

But the laugh ends quickly.

“That’s what you do,” she says. “You make everything pretty so you don’t have to decide.”

Then she shrugs.

“It’s okay. I like pretty too.”

Her smile turns dangerous.

“But don’t complain later when pretty becomes lonely.”

choices.text: Stop flirting and be serious (repair).
Lean into the chaos: tell her you like how she makes you feel alive.
End the call early (avoid).

c4_dasha_challenge.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_challenge.title: Dasha: Why You Run
c4_dasha_challenge.text:
“Why do you run?” you ask.

Dasha blinks — then smiles like you just said something interesting.

“Because staying is how people get owned,” she says.

She looks out the window.

“Because the moment someone says ‘mine’, I want to disappear.”

Then, quietly:

“And because if I stay… I might actually want something.”

Her gaze returns.

“You want me to stay?”

choices.text: Say yes (soft, sincere).
Say you don't know (she hates this).
Tell her you want honesty, not ownership (boundary).

c4_dasha_yes.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_yes.title: Dasha: Say It
c4_dasha_yes.text:
You say yes.

Dasha exhales, almost a laugh, almost a sigh.

“Okay,” she says. “Then prove you’re not a tourist in people.”

She sends you her location pin — a café name, a time.

And then adds:

“If you come, come clean.”

choices.text: Book the trip (commit).
Don’t book yet — ask to meet when she’s in Singapore next.

c4_dasha_maybe.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_maybe.title: Dasha: Maybe
c4_dasha_maybe.text:
You hesitate.

Dasha’s smile disappears.

“Okay,” she says simply. “Then don’t call me when you’re lonely.”

The call ends.

The screen goes dark.

And you realize: for some people, silence isn’t punishment.

It’s closure.

choices.text: Chase her immediately with a voice note (repair attempt).
Let it be (accept consequence).

c4_dasha_book_trip.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_book_trip.title: Dasha: Ticket
c4_dasha_book_trip.text:
You open the airline app like a man possessed.

Confirmation. Payment. A ticket that turns desire into logistics.

Dasha’s message arrives:

“Good. Now don’t lie to the other women.”

It’s the first time she acknowledges them without jealousy.

Just reality.

You stare at the sentence until it feels like a verdict.

choices.text: Text Xin Yi the truth tonight (clarity).
Tell Jannah first (gentle honesty).
Tell Almahirah first (integrity).
Tell Kira first (professional consequences).

c4_dasha_no.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_no.title: Dasha: No
c4_dasha_no.text:
You tell her you can’t come.

Dasha nods like she expected it.

“Okay,” she says. “That’s all I wanted. Truth.”

Then she smiles, softer than usual.

“Be good, Singapore boy. Don’t keep stealing pieces of people.”

And the call ends — clean, sharp, and sad.

choices.text: Go to the crossroads (choose who you repair next).

c4_dasha_after_kira.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_after_kira.title: Dasha: Wind in the Mic
c4_dasha_after_kira.text:
Dasha answers on video.

The background is moving — a car window, mountain road, streetlights smeared by rain.

“Hello, Singapore boy,” she says, grinning. “Are you alive?”

Her eyes are bright in a way that always feels like a dare.

“You’re quiet lately,” she says. “Did you become boring?”

She laughs.

Then, softer: “Or did you finally get hurt?”

choices.text: Tell her you got hurt (truth).
Flirt and keep it light (avoid depth).
Ask where she is and why she keeps running (challenge).

c4_xinyi_visit.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_visit.title: Xin Yi: Doorstep
c4_xinyi_visit.text:
You show up without a warning text.

Xin Yi opens the door like she’s been awake for hours.

She doesn’t ask why you’re here.

She asks, “Are you staying — or are you just passing through again?”

Her apartment smells like jasmine tea.

Her eyes look like someone who already decided she won’t beg.

choices.text: Stay. No phone. No excuses (1-on-1).
Ask to talk downstairs (less intimate).
Admit you came because you felt guilty (bad reason).

c4_xinyi_home_talk.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_home_talk.title: Xin Yi: The Hard Talk
c4_xinyi_home_talk.text:
Xin Yi sits opposite you, legs tucked under her, hands around a warm cup.

“I’m not competing,” she says. “I’m auditing your pattern.”

She lists it calmly:
• You show up intensely.
• You vanish.
• You return with words.
• You repeat.

Then she looks at you.

“I love you as a friend,” she says first. “That’s not the problem.”

The problem is the other thing — the unspoken possibility — and how it keeps bleeding into your friendship.

“So tell me,” she says. “What am I to you?”

choices.text: Call her your closest person (friendship first, protect it).
Admit you’ve thought about more (dangerous honesty).
Refuse to label it (she hates this).

c4_xinyi_what_wrong.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_what_wrong.title: Xin Yi: Say It
c4_xinyi_what_wrong.text:
“What’s wrong?” you ask.

Xin Yi exhales.

“If I say it, you’ll make it about fixing,” she says.

“And I don’t want to be fixed. I want to be *chosen*.”

Her voice is steady. Her eyes are not.

“Come over,” she repeats. “Or don’t. But stop hovering.”

choices.text: Go over now (choose presence).
Don’t go (distance).

c4_xinyi_downstairs.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_downstairs.title: Xin Yi: Public Air
c4_xinyi_downstairs.text:
You choose the corridor, the lift lobby — public air, safer distance.

Xin Yi nods like she expected you’d choose less risk.

“Okay,” she says.

Then, quieter:

“Just don’t pretend distance is the same as respect.”

She looks at your phone.

“You can stay out here if you want. But be honest about why.”

choices.text: Admit you’re scared of what you feel (truth).
Say you’re protecting the friendship (valid).
End the conversation (avoid).

c4_xinyi_guilt.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_guilt.title: Xin Yi: Guilt
c4_xinyi_guilt.text:
You admit you came because you felt guilty.

Xin Yi’s mouth tightens.

“Then go,” she says.

“I’m not your conscience.”

The door doesn’t slam.

That’s the worst part.

It just closes.

choices.text: Apologize properly (no guilt, just accountability).
Leave (take the loss).

c4_xinyi_closest.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_closest.title: Xin Yi: Closest Person
c4_xinyi_closest.text:
You tell her she’s your closest person.

Xin Yi blinks, surprised.

Then she nods slowly.

“Okay,” she says. “Then act like it.”

She sets a rule:

“No disappearing. If you’re overwhelmed, you say so. If you’re choosing someone else, you say so. I won’t compete, but I won’t be lied to.”

Her phone buzzes — Dasha’s name flashes in a group chat you all share.

Xin Yi doesn’t open it.

She watches you.

choices.text: Agree to the rule (friendship becomes stronger).
Break the rule immediately: ask her to give you space (backslide).

c4_xinyi_more.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_more.title: Xin Yi: More Than Friendship
c4_xinyi_more.text:
You admit you’ve thought about more.

Xin Yi doesn’t smile.

She just breathes, like she’s trying not to hope too fast.

“Then don’t say it casually,” she says.

“If you ever cross that line with me, it has to be serious. Because I don’t know how to half-love someone.”

Your phone lights: Almahirah’s message — “Are you awake?”

choices.text: Tell Xin Yi you want to try, properly (high commitment).
Tell Xin Yi you can’t promise yet (honest).
Step back to protect the friendship (boundary).

c4_xinyi_try.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_try.title: Xin Yi: Try
c4_xinyi_try.text:
“Properly,” you say.

Xin Yi nods once.

“Okay,” she whispers. “Then be brave.”

No kiss. No dramatic confession.

Just a quiet agreement that changes what everything means.

And now you have to live in the consequences of seriousness.

choices.text: Go to the crossroads (what do you do next?).

c4_xinyi_no_label.label: Chapter Four
c4_xinyi_no_label.title: Xin Yi: No Label
c4_xinyi_no_label.text:
You refuse to label it.

Xin Yi’s eyes harden.

“Then you’re not safe,” she says, simple as that.

She stands.

“I won’t hate you. I’ll just stop offering you access to me.”

She opens the door.

“Goodnight.”

choices.text: Stop her and choose a label (repair).
Leave (accept consequence).

c4_almah_meet.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_meet.title: Almahirah: After Maghrib
c4_almah_meet.text:
After Maghrib, the mosque is calmer.

Almahirah sits on a bench outside, hijab pinned neatly, expression composed.

She greets you with a small smile — familiar, not affectionate.

“You look tired,” she says.

Then, gently: “Are you taking care of yourself — or are you only taking care of your desires?”

She doesn’t ask like a jealous woman.

She asks like a nurse of the soul.

And because she’s your ex, the question carries a second edge:

She’s seen what you become when you avoid yourself.

choices.text: Tell her the truth (messy).
Ask for guidance without details (safe, but vague).
Flirt / lighten (she won't like it).

c4_almah_truth.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_truth.title: Almahirah: Integrity Check
c4_almah_truth.text:
You tell her what you can.
