Not everything. But enough that she sees the shape.

Almahirah listens, eyes steady.

Then she says, “You can love five people and still be selfish.”

A pause.

“Love isn’t a feeling. It’s amanah. Responsibility.”

She looks at you.

“So tell me: are you representing yourself honestly to all of them?”

Her tone is calm — the same calm that ended your relationship ten years ago without shouting.

It’s not anger she brings you.

It’s clarity.

choices.text: Yes — and you will keep it clean (integrity).
No — and you want to fix it (repent, repair).
Defend yourself (ego).

c4_almah_guidance.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_guidance.title: Almahirah: Guidance
c4_almah_guidance.text:
You ask for guidance without spilling details.

Almahirah tilts her head.

“That’s not guidance,” she says softly. “That’s wanting comfort without accountability.”

She doesn’t scold.

She offers:

“If you want peace, do the hard thing: be honest, even when it costs you.”

Her phone buzzes — a hospital shift reminder.

She stands.

“Do you want peace,” she asks, “or do you want permission?”

Then, almost as an afterthought — but it lands like history:

“Ten years ago, you wanted permission. Don’t come back to me unchanged.”

choices.text: Peace (choose honesty, even if it hurts).
Permission (she will pull back).
Ask her to stay longer anyway (vulnerable).

c4_almah_flirt.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_flirt.title: Almahirah: Not a Game
c4_almah_flirt.text:
You try to lighten the mood.

Almahirah smiles — but it’s polite.

“I’m not a game,” she says.

“And I’m not here for borrowed warmth.”

She stands, adjusting her bag strap.

“If you want me in your life, come as a man. Not as a mood.”

choices.text: Apologize and be serious now.
Let her leave (lose thread).

c4_almah_integrity_yes.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_integrity_yes.title: Almahirah: Hard Approval
c4_almah_integrity_yes.text:
You say yes.

Almahirah studies your face.

Then she nods once.

“Good,” she says. “Then keep your wudu clean in your heart too.”

It’s not romantic.

But it feels intimate — a person trusting your character.

As she leaves, she says:

“Sleep. Then decide.”

choices.text: Go to the crossroads (decide).

c4_almah_integrity_no.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_integrity_no.title: Almahirah: Fix It
c4_almah_integrity_no.text:
You admit you haven’t been fully honest.

Almahirah nods like she already knew.

“Then fix it,” she says. “Not with grand gestures. With clean truth.”

She looks at you like a test.

“Who will you tell first?”

choices.text: Tell Xin Yi first (closest friendship deserves truth).
Tell Jannah first (gentlest heart deserves clarity).
Tell Kira first (work consequences).
Tell Dasha first (she hates maybes).

c4_almah_stay.label: Chapter Four
c4_almah_stay.title: Almahirah: Stay
c4_almah_stay.text:
Almahirah hesitates.

Then she sits back down.

“Five minutes,” she says.

Those five minutes are quiet.

You don’t touch. You don’t flirt.

You just breathe in the same air.

When she stands again, she says:

“Don’t waste my sincerity.”

choices.text: Go to the crossroads.

c4_hide_in_work.label: Chapter Four
c4_hide_in_work.title: War Room Again
c4_hide_in_work.text:
You stay late.

You pretend you’re being responsible.

But the truth is simpler: you’re afraid of being seen.

You fix bugs, write docs, plan sprints.

Meanwhile, five unread notifications stack like unpaid debts.

At 1:12 a.m., your screen reflects your face back at you — tired, older, quieter.

A message arrives from Xin Yi:

“I’m done hovering. Goodnight.”

Then another from Jannah:

“Hope you’re okay.”

Then one from Dasha:

“Boring.”

And finally Almahirah:

“Allah knows. Be honest.”

Even work can’t hide you from yourself.

choices.text: Stop hiding. Choose someone to repair right now.

c4_truth_xinyi.label: Chapter Four
c4_truth_xinyi.title: Truth: Xin Yi
c4_truth_xinyi.text:
You tell Xin Yi the truth: there are other women in your life, and you are trying to stop lying by omission.

Xin Yi reads it. Then replies:

“Thank you for not insulting me with silence.”

A pause.

“Now choose what kind of man you are going to be. I’m not an option menu.”

choices.text: Ask to meet and talk properly (repair).
Give her space (respect).

c4_truth_jannah.label: Chapter Four
c4_truth_jannah.title: Truth: Jannah
c4_truth_jannah.text:
You tell Jannah the truth — gently, without drama.

There’s a long pause before she replies.

“Thank you for telling me,” she says.

And then:

“I need time. I’m still kind. But my heart is not a toy.”

choices.text: Respect her time and step back (care).
Ask to meet anyway (risk).

c4_truth_almah.label: Chapter Four
c4_truth_almah.title: Truth: Almahirah
c4_truth_almah.text:
You tell Almahirah the truth first.

She replies with one line:

“May Allah guide you to clarity.”

No judgment.

Just the quiet insistence that you become better.

choices.text: Go to the crossroads.

c4_truth_kira.label: Chapter Four
c4_truth_kira.title: Truth: Kira
c4_truth_kira.text:
You tell Kira there are other threads in your life, and you’re trying to keep work clean.

Kira replies:

“Good. Then keep it clean.”

A pause.

“And don’t bring chaos into my team.”

It isn’t romantic.

But it is permission to exist honestly.

choices.text: Go to the crossroads.

c4_truth_dasha.label: Chapter Four
c4_truth_dasha.title: Truth: Dasha
c4_truth_dasha.text:
You tell Dasha the truth: you’re tangled, and you’re trying to untangle without lying.

Dasha sends a voice note:

“Finally.”

Then, softer:

“Don’t choose me with guilt. Choose me with hunger. Or don’t choose me.”

choices.text: Go to the crossroads.

c4_crossroads.label: Chapter Four
c4_crossroads.title: Crossroads: Collisions, Not Convenience
c4_crossroads.text:
By the end of the week, you realize the truth:

Branching doesn’t mean freedom.
It means you carry consequences in parallel.

Some nights you meet one person and the others only exist as unread messages.
Some nights two worlds collide and you have to pick a door *in real time*.

And now the story will stop merging your choices into a single safe road.

From here, every thread will keep its memory.

Choose your next step.

choices.text: Lean toward Kira (career + forbidden heat).
Lean toward Jannah (warmth + steadiness).
Lean toward Dasha (risk + travel).
Lean toward Xin Yi (friendship turning serious).
Lean toward Almahirah (faith + accountability).
Try to hold all threads anyway (hard mode).

c5_start_kira.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_kira.title: Kira: The Line Between
c5_start_kira.text:
Kira asks you to meet after work.

Not in the office.
Not on a call.
A quiet place where she can’t hide behind urgency.

She arrives in a blazer anyway.

“You’ve been… distracted,” she says, like she’s reviewing a system drifting out of spec.

Her eyes settle on you.

“Are you a liability to my team, or are you someone I can still trust?”

It’s a professional question.

But the way she says it makes it personal.

Tonight is just the two of you.

choices.text: Choose clarity: own your mess and ask for time to fix it (risking her respect).
Choose control: keep it strictly professional (safe, colder).
Choose the dangerous truth: admit she matters to you (career risk).

c5_start_jannah.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_jannah.title: Jannah: The Quiet Ask
c5_start_jannah.text:
Jannah meets you after her preschool shift.

She smells faintly of hand sanitizer and baby powder — the honest kind of exhaustion.

She doesn’t bring drama.
She brings a question she’s been holding for too long.

“Are you here because you choose me,” she asks softly, “or because I’m the place you recover before you go back to your real life?”

There is no crowd.
No interruptions.

Just the two of you and the truth.

choices.text: Tell her she’s not a pit stop — and back it with a concrete plan for the week.
Ask for patience without giving direction (risk losing her).
Be brave: ask if she would try dating properly (clear intent).

c5_start_dasha.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_dasha.title: Dasha: The Moving Horizon
c5_start_dasha.text:
Dasha’s voice note arrives first.

Then a location pin.

Not Sapa.
Not Seoul.

Singapore, for once.

“One evening,” she writes. “I’m leaving again tomorrow. Don’t make it pretty. Make it real.”

When you meet her, she looks at you like she can tell whether you’re lying by how you breathe.

Tonight is just the two of you — no crowd to hide behind.

choices.text: Show up fully: no jokes, no deflection, just honesty.
Keep it romantic but vague (safe, shallow).
Ask her to stay longer (big ask, big risk).

c5_start_xinyi.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_xinyi.title: Xin Yi: The Familiar Edge
c5_start_xinyi.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t invite you out.

She invites you in.

To a night with your close friend group — and then, after everyone leaves, to the moment that always arrives:

Just the two of you.

She pours water. Not wine.

“Tell me what we are,” she says. “Not with feelings. With decisions.”

Her voice is steady.

That’s how you know she’s serious.

choices.text: Offer one-month exclusivity with rules (clean direction).
Refuse exclusivity, but confess you’re scared of losing her (vulnerable honesty).
Avoid it again (pattern).

c5_start_almah.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_almah.title: Almahirah: The Discipline of Care
c5_start_almah.text:
You meet Almahirah after her shift.

Her uniform is gone, but the tiredness remains — the kind earned, not performed.

She sits with a warm drink and watches you like she’s listening to your character, not your words.

“You’ve been choosing,” she says.

Not accusing.
Stating a fact.

“Tell me: are you becoming better, or just busier?”

Tonight is just the two of you — and your conscience.

choices.text: Tell her the truth fully (no omissions).
Give a partial truth (safer, weaker).
Ask her what she would do in your place (seeking guidance).

c5_start_hardmode.label: Chapter Five
c5_start_hardmode.title: Hard Mode: Same Week, Same Knife
c5_start_hardmode.text:
Some weeks don’t allow you to choose one thread at a time.

The calendar stacks.
The emotions stack.

And you realize: if you keep trying to be “fair”, you will only become forgettable.

Hard Mode begins with one rule:

You must choose one priority for the week — and accept the cost.

No looping.
No farming.
Just consequence.

choices.text: Prioritize Work (Kira’s world).
Prioritize Stability (Xin Yi’s world).
Prioritize Heart (Jannah’s world).
Prioritize Courage (Dasha’s world).
Prioritize Accountability (Almahirah’s world).

c4_dasha_chaos.label: Chapter Four
c4_dasha_chaos.title: Dasha: Chaos
c4_dasha_chaos.text:
You tell Dasha you like how she makes you feel alive.

Dasha smiles, satisfied — then her expression softens.

“Alive is easy,” she says. “Staying is hard.”

She leans closer to the camera.

“Don’t make me your escape hatch. Make me your choice — or leave me alone.”

choices.text: Make her your choice (book the trip).
Admit you used her as escape (honest, painful).
End the call and sit with the shame (growth).

c4_jannah_after_kira.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_after_kira.title: Jannah: The Missed Call
c4_jannah_after_kira.text:
You call Jannah back.

She answers quietly, like she stepped into a stairwell to speak.

“Sorry,” she says. “I didn’t want to disturb you.”

You can hear the tired in her breath.

“I just… had a hard moment. It passed. But I wanted to hear your voice.”

She pauses.

“Can you come? Just for a little while?”

choices.text: Go to her now (presence).
Ask her to talk on the phone instead (distance).
Tell her you can’t tonight (this will sting).

c4_jannah_phone_only.label: Chapter Four
c4_jannah_phone_only.title: Jannah: Phone-Only
c4_jannah_phone_only.text:
You stay where you are, but you give her your full attention through the call.

Jannah talks until her voice steadies.

“Thank you,” she whispers. “I know you’re busy.”

Then she adds, softer:

“I hope one day I’m not just the person you call when you feel guilty.”

choices.text: Promise you’ll show up next time (action).
Go anyway — change your mind and head over now.
Say nothing (avoid).

prologue_weave.label: Prologue
prologue_weave.title: The Five Rooms
prologue_weave.text:
You don’t fall asleep.

You drift.

A fluorescent war room. A child’s gratitude card. A mountain town where the air tastes like rain. A kitchen table in Singapore where laughter sounds like home. A marble courtyard under night sky, where sincerity is measured in actions, not words.

They don’t arrive in order.

Your mind jumps the way hearts do when they’re afraid of choosing.

Which room do you step into next?

choices.text: Step into the war room memory — Kira, and the language of pressure.
Follow the classroom light — Jannah, and the softness you keep postponing.
Breathe in the mist — Dasha, and the intimacy of impermanence.
Return to the familiar table — Xin Yi, and friendship turning dangerous.
Walk the marble again — Almahirah, and the cost of intention.
Stop replaying. Open your eyes. Tonight begins.

c5_kira_own_it.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_own_it.title: Kira: Owning It
c5_kira_own_it.text:
You don’t defend yourself.

You lay out the truth: you’ve been trying to keep too many doors open, and it’s starting to bleed into your work.

Kira’s gaze doesn’t soften.
But it steadies.

“Good,” she says. “Now fix it.”

Then, quieter:

“And don’t confuse my patience for permission.”

choices.text: Ask for one clear week to stabilize the project — and your life.
Admit you want her, not just her respect (dangerous).

c5_kira_professional.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_professional.title: Kira: Clean Lines
c5_kira_professional.text:
You keep it clean.

Work talk. Deliverables. Boundaries.

Kira nods.

“Good.”

But when she turns to leave, she pauses.

“Just so you know,” she adds, without looking back,
“if you ever choose to make this messy, I won’t save you from the consequences.”

choices.text: Accept the boundary and move forward (stability).
Stop her: “What if I want to be worth the mess?”

c5_kira_confess.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_confess.title: Kira: The Dangerous Truth
c5_kira_confess.text:
The words come out before you can optimize them.

“I care about you.”

Kira’s breath catches — barely.

Then she exhales.

“Don’t,” she says.

Not because she hates it.

Because she’s afraid of it.

“If you’re going to say things like that,” she continues,
“then your actions had better match.”

choices.text: Promise action: reduce your other threads this week (choice has costs).
Walk it back and keep it professional (damage control).

c5_kira_edge_line.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_edge_line.title: Kira: Edge Line
c5_kira_edge_line.text:
Kira looks at you the way she looks at a risky deployment.

Not “no”.
Not “yes”.

A measured pause.

“If you want closeness,” she says, “prove you can handle it.”

Your phone buzzes.

A message from Xin Yi.
A missed call from Jannah.
A location pin from Dasha.

And Almahirah asking, once:

“Did you keep your word?”

choices.text: Put the phone away and stay with Kira tonight (1-on-1 priority).
End the night early and choose one person to repair now.
Tell Kira you need time (avoid).

c5_kira_after_stay.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_after_stay.title: Kira: After You Choose Her
c5_kira_after_stay.text:
The conversation slows.

Kira doesn’t become soft.

But she becomes honest.

“I don’t do half,” she says. “And I don’t share.”

It isn’t a threat.

It’s a boundary.

And it forces you to see how serious this could become.

choices.text: Acknowledge her boundary and move into the week with consequences.
Ask for one week to decide properly (set a timer).

c5_jannah_plan.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_plan.title: Jannah: A Week With You In It
c5_jannah_plan.text:
You open your calendar.

You put her in it — clearly.

Not “sometime”. Not “soon”.

Real.

Jannah watches your screen and then your face.

Her shoulders drop a little.

“That’s all I wanted,” she whispers. “To know I’m not imagining you.”

choices.text: Keep the plan and let it reshape your week.
Invite her to meet your close friends (public clarity).

c5_jannah_distance.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_distance.title: Jannah: The Door That Quietly Closes
c5_jannah_distance.text:
Jannah nods as if she understands.

But her eyes don’t.

“I can be patient,” she says.

Then she adds:

“But I won’t be small.”

When she leaves, the emptiness feels deliberate.

choices.text: Chase her and apologize properly (repair).
Let her go for now (you’ll regret this later).

c5_jannah_date_offer.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_date_offer.title: Jannah: The Brave Ask
c5_jannah_date_offer.text:
You say it plainly.

No performance.

“Let’s try dating properly.”

Jannah’s cheeks flush.

She looks down, then up.

“Okay,” she says.

And that one word changes the shape of your week.

choices.text: Keep it private first (protect it).
Make it visible (invite her into your friend group hang).

c5_jannah_private_date.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_private_date.title: Jannah: Private Date
c5_jannah_private_date.text:
It’s simple.

A meal. A walk. No big declarations.

Jannah laughs at something small you say, and you realize you’ve been starving for ordinary joy.

Halfway through, your phone buzzes.

Kira: “Need you. Now.”

choices.text: Ignore work for one hour (choose Jannah fully).
Take the call, but be honest with Jannah (no hiding).

c5_jannah_public.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_public.title: Jannah: In The Room
c5_jannah_public.text:
Your close friend group notices.

They don’t tease.

They just watch you differently — like they’re measuring whether you’ll treat her with the care she deserves.

Xin Yi is there too.

Her smile is polite.

But her eyes are tired.

This is a collision you created.

choices.text: Sit beside Jannah (visible choice).
Split your attention (avoid choosing in public).

c5_jannah_repair.label: Chapter Five
c5_jannah_repair.title: Jannah: Repair
c5_jannah_repair.text:
You find her outside.

You don’t justify.
You don’t defend.

You just say:

“I’m sorry. I didn’t realize I was asking you to wait without giving you direction.”

Jannah’s eyes shine.

She nods.

“Then give me direction,” she whispers.

choices.text: Give direction (date/time + priority).
Admit you can’t (let her go gently).

c5_dasha_truth.label: Chapter Five
c5_dasha_truth.title: Dasha: No More Pretty
c5_dasha_truth.text:
You tell her the truth you usually keep behind charm.

The fear.
The habit of postponing.
The way you want depth but keep choosing comfort.

Dasha listens.

Then she smiles — not amused.

Relieved.

“Good,” she says. “Now you’re real.”

choices.text: Ask what she wants from you (direct).
Ask if she’d stay in Singapore longer (big ask).

c5_dasha_shallow.label: Chapter Five
c5_dasha_shallow.title: Dasha: The Smile That Doesn’t Reach
c5_dasha_shallow.text:
You keep it light.

Dasha laughs — and you almost believe it.

But when she turns away, you catch it:

The disappointment she tries not to show.

“It’s okay,” she says. “I know who you are when it gets real.”

choices.text: Stop her and correct it (repair now).
Let it end (you lose the rare window).

c5_dasha_ask_stay.label: Chapter Five
c5_dasha_ask_stay.title: Dasha: Stay
c5_dasha_ask_stay.text:
You ask.

Dasha blinks, surprised.

Then she looks at you like she’s weighing whether you mean it.

“If I stay,” she says, “you don’t get to treat me like a vacation.”

Your phone buzzes.

A work notification.
A message from Xin Yi.

This is the price of asking someone to stay.

choices.text: Commit: “Stay. I’ll make space.”
Back off: “I can’t promise that.”

c5_dasha_terms.label: Chapter Five
c5_dasha_terms.title: Dasha: Terms
c5_dasha_terms.text:
Dasha leans back.

“One thing,” she says. “Don’t chase me to feel brave. Chase me because you choose me.”

She looks at your hands.

“If you keep five doors open, you’ll live in a corridor forever.”

choices.text: Choose one door this week (hard choice).
Ask for time (risk losing her).

c5_xinyi_month_rules.label: Chapter Five
c5_xinyi_month_rules.title: Xin Yi: Month Rules
c5_xinyi_month_rules.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t smile.

She takes out her phone.

“Rules,” she says.

1) No mixed signals.
2) No secret meetings.
3) If you break the rules, you don’t beg.

“Can you do that?” she asks.

It feels less like romance.
More like dignity.

choices.text: Agree and message the others with clarity (clean but painful).
Agree but avoid messaging the others (cowardice).

c5_xinyi_vulnerable.label: Chapter Five
c5_xinyi_vulnerable.title: Xin Yi: Vulnerable Honesty
c5_xinyi_vulnerable.text:
You tell her you’re scared.

Not of commitment.

Of doing it wrong.

Xin Yi listens, then nods slowly.

“Then do it right,” she says. “Not perfect. Right.”

choices.text: Ask for one week to prove change (set a timer).
Offer exclusivity anyway (brave).

c5_xinyi_break.label: Chapter Five
c5_xinyi_break.title: Xin Yi: The Break
c5_xinyi_break.text:
You avoid it.

Xin Yi doesn’t chase.

She simply nods.

“Okay.”

And the way she says it feels like a door closing without a slam.

choices.text: Stop her and choose clarity now (repair).
Let her go (consequence).

c5_almah_full_truth.label: Chapter Five
c5_almah_full_truth.title: Almahirah: Full Truth
c5_almah_full_truth.text:
You tell her everything.

Not names-as-trophies.

But patterns.
Weakness.
The way you keep postponing a real choice.

Almahirah listens, then says softly:

“Thank you for not lying to me.”

It’s the closest thing to affection she offers.

And it feels heavy with meaning.

choices.text: Ask how to proceed with integrity (guidance).
Ask her if she wants you to choose her (direct).

c5_almah_partial.label: Chapter Five
c5_almah_partial.title: Almahirah: Partial Truth
c5_almah_partial.text:
You soften the edges.

You leave out the parts that make you look worst.

Almahirah’s eyes narrow slightly.

Not angry.

Disappointed.

“Okay,” she says. “Then you’re still performing.”

choices.text: Correct it (tell the full truth now).
Leave (you failed the test).

c5_almah_guidance.label: Chapter Five
c5_almah_guidance.title: Almahirah: Guidance
c5_almah_guidance.text:
Almahirah thinks for a long time.

Then she says:

“Choose the path that makes you more responsible, not more entertained.”

She watches you.

“And if you can’t choose yet, don’t take more than you can return.”

Her voice softens, just slightly.

“I once trusted your potential. That didn’t end well.”

A pause.

“So if you want me in your life again, don’t sell me the future. Show me the present.”

choices.text: Commit to a decision date and tell everyone (integrity).
Ask to see her again next week (slow, principled).

c5_almah_choose_me.label: Chapter Five
c5_almah_choose_me.title: Almahirah: Choose Me?
c5_almah_choose_me.text:
You ask.

Almahirah doesn’t answer fast.

“If you choose me,” she says, “you don’t get to treat faith like an aesthetic.”

Her voice is gentle.

But it’s firm.

“I will not be your experiment.”

Then she adds the line that makes your chest tighten:

“Ten years ago, I loved you. And you still left like love was optional.”

She meets your eyes.

“So if you’re choosing me now, choose me like you’ve learned.”

choices.text: Promise seriousness and consistency (no games).
Back off and keep it respectful (slow).

c5_repair_picker.label: Chapter Five
c5_repair_picker.title: Repair Picker
c5_repair_picker.text:
You can’t repair everyone at once.

Pick one person and do it properly — not with a vague apology, but with action.

(Choose carefully. This will shape your Chapter Five ending.)

choices.text: Repair Xin Yi (clarity + plan).
Repair Jannah (presence).
Repair Dasha (courage).
Repair Almahirah (accountability).
Repair Kira (work trust).

c5_hub.label: Chapter Five
c5_hub.title: The Week Map
c5_hub.text:
Chapter Five isn’t one straight line.

It’s a week where every choice costs something.

Pick where you go next. (You can’t do everything.)

choices.text: Meet Kira 1-on-1 again (work + boundary).
Meet Jannah 1-on-1 (presence).
Meet Dasha 1-on-1 (courage).
Meet Xin Yi 1-on-1 (clarity).
Meet Almahirah 1-on-1 (accountability).
End the week and face consequences.

c5_kira_week_priority.title: Week Priority: Work
c5_kira_week_priority.text:

c5_kira_deep.text:

No optimization.

You speak carefully.

And Kira listens like this matters.

choices.text: Make a concrete commitment this week.

c5_kira_collision.label: Chapter Five
c5_kira_collision.title: Kira: Collision
c5_kira_collision.text:
Even with a priority chosen, the others don’t freeze.

Your phone buzzes mid-conversation.

You see another name.

And you realize: priorities are proven in collisions.

choices.text: Hold your priority (consistency).

No optimization.

Only the part where you either grow — or repeat.

You speak carefully, because she’s the one person here who can compare who you are now with who you were ten years ago.

And Almahirah listens like this matters — not because she wants you back, but because fate already gave you a second meeting in Mecca, and she refuses to let it become meaningless.

c5_almah_collision.label: Chapter Five
c5_almah_collision.title: Almahirah: Collision
c5_almah_collision.text:
Even with a priority chosen, the others don’t freeze.

Your phone buzzes mid-conversation.

You see another name.

Almahirah notices the micro-flinch in your thumb — she always noticed your tells.

And you realize: priorities are proven in collisions.

Not with speeches.

With what you do when the past, the present, and temptation all ring at once.

choices.text: Hold your priority (consistency).
Break priority to repair the other thread (messy, human).

c5_crossroads.label: Chapter Five
c5_crossroads.title: Crossroads: Consequence Week
c5_crossroads.text:
By the end of the week, you can feel which bonds grew — and which ones thinned.

You also realize something brutal:

If you keep trying to be loved by everyone, you will eventually be trusted by no one.

Chapter Five ends with one question:

What do you do next — double down, repair, or finally choose?

choices.text: Double down on one thread (commitment path).
Attempt repair across the board (hard, messy).
Don’t choose yet (delay).

c5_commitment_picker.label: Chapter Five
c5_commitment_picker.title: Commitment Picker
c5_commitment_picker.text:
Choose one person to prioritize going forward.

This doesn’t end the others immediately.

But it changes how they see you.

choices.text: Choose Kira.
Choose Jannah.
Choose Dasha.
Choose Xin Yi.
Choose Almahirah.

c5_commit_kira.label: Chapter Five
c5_commit_kira.title: Kira: Commitment
c5_commit_kira.text:
You choose Kira — not with a speech, but with a decision.

Kira nods once.

“Then act like it,” she says.

In her world, affection is proven by consistency under pressure.

It doesn’t magically erase the other four.

But it gives the week a spine.

And it gives Chapter Six a direction.

choices.text: End Chapter Five.

c5_commit_jannah.label: Chapter Five
c5_commit_jannah.title: Jannah: Commitment
c5_commit_jannah.text:
You choose Jannah — not with a speech, but with a decision.

Jannah’s eyes shine.

“Okay,” she whispers.

You feel something settle — the peace of choosing softness without shame.

It doesn’t magically erase the other four.

But it gives the week a spine.

And it gives Chapter Six a direction.

choices.text: End Chapter Five.

c5_commit_dasha.label: Chapter Five
c5_commit_dasha.title: Dasha: Commitment
c5_commit_dasha.text:
You choose Dasha — not with a speech, but with a decision.

Dasha laughs, bright.

“Finally,” she says.

Choosing her feels like stepping into wind and trusting you won’t fall.

It doesn’t magically erase the other four.

But it gives the week a spine.

And it gives Chapter Six a direction.

choices.text: End Chapter Five.

c5_commit_xinyi.label: Chapter Five
c5_commit_xinyi.title: Xin Yi: Commitment
c5_commit_xinyi.text:
You choose Xin Yi — not with a speech, but with a decision.

Xin Yi exhales like she’s been holding her breath for years.

“Good,” she says.

“No more half.”

It doesn’t magically erase the other four.

But it gives the week a spine.

And it gives Chapter Six a direction.

choices.text: End Chapter Five.

c5_commit_almah.label: Chapter Five
c5_commit_almah.title: Almahirah: Commitment
c5_commit_almah.text:
You choose Almahirah — not with a speech, but with a decision.

Almahirah doesn’t romanticize it.

She just says:

“Then be responsible.”

And somehow, that feels like love.

It doesn’t magically erase the other four.

But it gives the week a spine.

And it gives Chapter Six a direction.

choices.text: End Chapter Five.

c5_end.label: Chapter Five
c5_end.title: End of Chapter Five
c5_end.text:
Chapter Five ends with consequence.

Some people feel closer.
Some people feel wary.

And you can no longer pretend the corridor will last forever.

Continue when you’re ready.

choices.text: Continue to Chapter Six.

c6_start.label: Chapter Six
c6_start.title: Residual Heat
c6_start.text:
Monday arrives like a spreadsheet: neat columns hiding messy truths.

You’re back in Singapore, back to your tech/engineering job—back under Kira’s calm, sharp supervision.

But your phone still holds five threads, each with its own gravity:
• Kira — your boss, whose attention feels like a risk you keep touching.
• Jannah Raudah — a preschool teacher with warmth that never feels performative.
• Dasha Taran — a Kazakh traveler in Sapa, rare and hard to repeat.
• Xin Yi — the close friend whose comfort is becoming dangerous.
• Almahirah — a Singaporean nurse, one year younger than you, whose faith-and-duty steadiness asks for honesty.

This week isn’t about grand romance.
It’s about what you *do* when life is ordinary again.

Your first decision is small.
Which is why it matters.

choices.text: Start with work: stabilize the project with Kira.
Start with people: clear your inbox before the day drags you.
Start with discipline: put your phone away until lunch.

c6_phone_away.label: Chapter Six
c6_phone_away.title: Phone Face-Down
c6_phone_away.text:
You flip the phone face-down like it’s a temptation.

For once, you don’t begin the day in five conversations at once.

The quiet feels clean.

But clean can also feel lonely.

choices.text: Hold the boundary until lunch. Focus.
Break at 10am. Check messages anyway.

c6_inbox.label: Chapter Six
c6_inbox.title: Five Threads
c6_inbox.text:
Notifications stack like tiny debts.

Kira: a meeting invite, short and precise.

Jannah: a photo of finger-painted planets. “My kids made Saturn today.”

Dasha: a voice note—wind, laughter, a market somewhere in Sapa.

Xin Yi: “Coffee later? Don’t dodge.”

Almahirah: “Shift ends 9pm. If you’re awake, I’ll reply.”

You can’t answer everyone well.
But you can answer someone honestly.

choices.text: Reply Kira first (professional).
Reply Jannah first (warm).
Reply Dasha first (rare connection).
Reply Xin Yi first (close friend).
Reply Almahirah first (grounded).

c6_kira_morning.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_morning.title: Stand-Up Meeting
c6_kira_morning.text:
The meeting room smells like coffee and deadlines.

Kira stands at the whiteboard, sleeves rolled, expression unreadable.

When she looks at you, it’s not warmth.
It’s *focus*.

“Status,” she says.

You explain. You simplify. You don’t joke.

Kira nods once.

After the meeting, she lingers.

“You’ve been distracted lately,” she says quietly.

Not accusation.
Assessment.

choices.text: Own it: admit life’s messy and you’re fixing it.
Deflect: say you’re fine and change the topic.
Risk it: ask if she’s worried about you—or about performance.

c6_kira_own_it.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_own_it.title: No Excuses
c6_kira_own_it.text:
You don’t dress it up.

“I’ve been trying to carry too much,” you say. “It won’t spill into the project again.”

Kira’s gaze holds you for a beat.

“Good,” she says.

Then, softer than usual:

“If you need a clean plan, bring it to me. Don’t freestyle under pressure.”

choices.text: Offer a clean plan for the week (responsible).
Thank her and keep distance (safe).
Ask to talk after hours (dangerous line).

c6_kira_deflect.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_deflect.title: Professional Mask
c6_kira_deflect.text:
“I’m fine,” you say.

Kira doesn’t argue.

She just studies you like a bug report that hasn’t reproduced yet.

“Fine,” she repeats.

And the word feels like a door closing.

choices.text: Recover: send her the updated timeline by noon.
Double down: avoid her for the rest of the day.

c6_kira_edge.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_edge.title: What Are We Doing?
c6_kira_edge.text:
You keep your voice low.

“Are you worried about me,” you ask, “or about the work?”

Kira’s lips twitch—almost a smile.

“Both,” she says.

Then she steps back.

“Don’t confuse my attention for permission.”

choices.text: Back off: respect the line.
Hold the gaze: “I’m not asking for permission. I’m asking what you want.”

c6_kira_plan.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_plan.title: The Plan
c6_kira_plan.text:
You draft a timeline with buffers and ownership clearly assigned.

Kira scans it, then nods.

“This is you,” she says.

It’s the closest she comes to praise.

As she turns away, she pauses.

“Also,” she adds, “eat lunch. You get stupid when you skip.”

choices.text: Do as told. Go to lunch.
Joke lightly: “Yes, boss.”

c6_kira_after_hours_invite.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_after_hours_invite.title: After Hours
c6_kira_after_hours_invite.text:
You ask anyway.

Kira’s eyes flick to the glass wall, the office beyond, the risk in fluorescent light.

“Not here,” she says.

A pause.

“Seven. Downstairs. Five minutes.”

It’s not a date.

Which is exactly why it feels like one.

choices.text: Agree—and keep it quiet.
Change your mind: keep boundaries.

c6_lunch_hub.label: Chapter Six
c6_lunch_hub.title: Lunch Break: The City Keeps Moving
c6_lunch_hub.text:
Lunch arrives like a pause button you don’t deserve.

Your phone vibrates.

Somewhere else, other lives are still happening:
— a classroom with tiny chairs.
— a windy hill town in Sapa.
— a hospital corridor.
— a café table with your name already remembered.

You can do one thing well.

Choose.

choices.text: Meet Xin Yi for coffee (1-on-1).
Call Jannah while she’s on break (1-on-1).
Listen to Dasha’s voice note and reply properly (1-on-1).
Message Almahirah: ask about her shift and her day (1-on-1).
Stay at your desk. Work. (no romance, just stability).

c6_xinyi_midday.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_midday.title: Coffee? Don’t Dodge.
c6_xinyi_midday.text:
Xin Yi’s message is simple.

Which is its own pressure.

You type, erase, then type again:

“Okay. Lunch.”

Three dots appear.

“Good,” she replies.

“No running.”

choices.text: Meet her at lunch.

c6_xinyi_meet.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_meet.title: The Friend Who Knows Your Tells
c6_xinyi_meet.text:
Xin Yi is already there when you arrive.

She doesn’t greet you like a date.

She greets you like someone who has watched you avoid hard conversations for years.

“Sit,” she says.

You sit.

Her eyes soften.

“Are you okay?”

It’s not flirtation.
It’s intimacy.

choices.text: Tell her the real truth: you’re tangled and tired of lying.
Keep it light: joke, deflect, pretend it’s normal.
Cross the line: admit you’ve been thinking of her differently.

c6_xinyi_truth.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_truth.title: Clarity Over Comfort
c6_xinyi_truth.text:
You tell her.

Not every detail.
Just the shape of it:

Too many people.
Too many half-promises.

Xin Yi listens without interrupting.

Then she nods.

“Okay,” she says.

“Then do one thing this week that proves you can be honest.”

choices.text: Ask her what she needs from you (specifics).
Promise you’ll choose soon (vague).

c6_xinyi_needs.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_needs.title: What She Needs
c6_xinyi_needs.text:
“Don’t make me compete with your silence,” Xin Yi says.

“If you’re with me tonight, be with me.
If you’re not, say it.”

It’s the kind of boundary that makes you respect her more.

And fear losing her.

choices.text: Agree: no more half-presence.
Hesitate: “I’ll try.”

c6_xinyi_deflect.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_deflect.title: Old Habits
c6_xinyi_deflect.text:
You smile. You joke.

Xin Yi doesn’t laugh.

She stirs her drink slowly.

“You do this,” she says.

“You turn everything into a bit.
And then you wonder why people stop trusting you.”

choices.text: Apologize and reset (humble).
Get defensive (ego).

c6_xinyi_confess.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_confess.title: The Dangerous Comfort
c6_xinyi_confess.text:
You say it softly.

That she’s been on your mind.
That comfort has started to feel like wanting.

Xin Yi doesn’t look shocked.

She looks… sad.

“I’m not a consolation prize,” she says.

“If you choose me, it has to be because you see me.”

choices.text: Promise: you see her (and you’ll prove it).
Back off: keep it friendship for now.

c6_jannah_midday.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_midday.title: Saturn in Finger Paint
c6_jannah_midday.text:
You reply to Jannah: something gentle, something real.

She replies fast.

“They keep asking if planets can have feelings,” she texts.

“I told them yes, because humans do, and we’re basically stardust.”

You laugh out loud, alone at your desk.

choices.text: Call her at lunch.

c6_jannah_call.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_call.title: Break Time
c6_jannah_call.text:
Jannah answers with background noise—tiny voices, a teacher’s patience.

“Hi,” she says, like she’s been waiting.

You hear a child yell her name.

“Give me one minute,” she tells them, then returns to you.

“How are you really?”

choices.text: Be honest: you’re overwhelmed and ashamed of it.
Be sweet: tell her you missed her voice.
Be vague: keep it light.

c6_jannah_honest.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_honest.title: Soft Doesn’t Mean Weak
c6_jannah_honest.text:
You tell her you’ve been trying to keep too many people happy.

Jannah doesn’t scold.

She breathes.

“You don’t have to earn care by suffering,” she says.

“But you do have to be fair.”

choices.text: Ask to meet her after work (1-on-1).
Thank her and promise a clear talk soon.

c6_jannah_sweet.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_sweet.title: The Kind of Love That Feeds You
c6_jannah_sweet.text:
“I missed you,” you admit.

Jannah goes quiet.

Then she laughs, small.

“Okay,” she says. “That makes today better.”

You can almost picture her smile—gentle, tired, still bright.

choices.text: Ask to meet her after work (1-on-1).
Keep it to calls for now.

c6_jannah_evening_meet.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_evening_meet.title: After School, After Noise
c6_jannah_evening_meet.text:
You meet Jannah near a quiet park.

She’s in simple clothes, hair tied back, still carrying that teacher calm.

You walk side by side.

No rush.

Jannah looks up at you.

“If you’re choosing,” she says, “choose with kindness. Not with guilt.”

choices.text: Hold her hand and ask for a chance to do this properly.
Keep space: “I want to, but I’m not ready.”

c6_dasha_midday.label: Chapter Six
c6_dasha_midday.title: Wind in Sapa
c6_dasha_midday.text:
You press play.

Dasha’s voice note is half laughter, half breath.

“I found the best grilled corn,” she says.

Then: “You’d like it here.
But you’d also get cold.
You’re a city boy.”

You find yourself smiling like an idiot.

choices.text: Call her when you can.

c6_dasha_call.label: Chapter Six
c6_dasha_call.title: Time Zones and Temptation
c6_dasha_call.text:
Dasha picks up on the third ring.

Her camera is shaky; fog behind her, a street of lanterns.

“Singapore?” she teases.

“Boring?”

You tell her about work.

She listens, eyes bright.

“You are always building,” she says.

“When do you live?”

choices.text: Admit: you don’t know. Ask her what she’s running from.
Flirt: tell her you’d live if she was here.
Keep it casual: let it be a nice call.

c6_dasha_depth.label: Chapter Six
c6_dasha_depth.title: The Thing Behind Her Smile
c6_dasha_depth.text:
Dasha’s grin fades into something quieter.

“Maybe I’m not running,” she says.

“Maybe I’m just… allergic to staying.”

She looks at you.

“If you come to Sapa, don’t come as a tourist.
Come as someone who means it.”

choices.text: Say you’ll plan a real trip (commitment).
Stay honest: you can’t promise yet.

c6_dasha_flirt.label: Chapter Six
c6_dasha_flirt.title: Heat Through a Screen
c6_dasha_flirt.text:
Dasha laughs.

“Careful,” she says.

“Words are cheap.
Flights are not.”

Her eyes narrow, playful.

“So—are you buying?”

choices.text: Play back: “Give me a date.”
Pull back: keep it grounded.

c6_almah_midday.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_midday.title: Hospital Light
c6_almah_midday.text:
Almahirah replies between tasks.

Short, tidy messages.

“Busy. But okay.”

Then:

“How are you holding up?”

You can feel her discipline in every word—like she refuses to waste what little time she has.

choices.text: Tell her the truth and ask to see her after her shift.
Keep it simple: wish her a good shift.

c6_almah_text.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_text.title: After Shift?
c6_almah_text.text:
You tell Almahirah you’re proud of her work.

She doesn’t flirt.

She just says:

“Don’t romanticize me. I’m tired.”

A pause.

“But… if you want to talk, 9:30. Hospital café.”

choices.text: Be there. On time. (1-on-1)
Admit you might be late because of work.

c6_almah_warning.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_warning.title: No More Half-Presence
c6_almah_warning.text:
Almahirah’s reply is immediate.

“Then don’t come.”

“I’m not collecting apologies this week.”

You stare at the message.

It feels unfair.

And also… fair.

choices.text: Recommit: tell her you’ll make it, no excuses.
Respect it: don’t go. Let it be.

c6_almah_cafe.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_cafe.title: Hospital Café (Quiet, Real)
c6_almah_cafe.text:
The hospital café is too bright for secrets.

Almahirah sits with a cup of tea, hair tied back, eyes tired but clear.

“I’m one year younger than you,” she says suddenly.

“But I feel older than most men I meet.”

She watches you.

“So tell me—are you serious about anyone? Or are you just lonely?”

choices.text: Serious: admit you want something real, and you’re learning how.
Lonely: admit you’ve been using attention as anesthesia.
Defensive: say it’s none of her business.

c6_almah_hard_truth.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_hard_truth.title: Anesthesia
c6_almah_hard_truth.text:
Almahirah nods like she already knew.

“Then stop,” she says.

“Loneliness is not a reason to take someone’s future.”

Her voice isn’t cruel.

It’s kind in a way that refuses to lie to you.

choices.text: Thank her. Ask what accountability looks like.
Shrink away from it. Change the topic.

c6_afternoon_hub.label: Chapter Six
c6_afternoon_hub.title: Afternoon: Collisions Don’t Ask Permission
c6_afternoon_hub.text:
The day drags.

Work pings. Messages wait. People have their own schedules.

Tonight, you will not get a perfect stage.

You will get life.

And life sometimes throws two names into the same moment.

choices.text: Go to the 7pm downstairs talk with Kira (if you set it).
Go meet Xin Yi again (she asked for no half-presence).
Go to the park with Jannah (if arranged).
Go to the hospital café for Almahirah’s post-shift talk.
Stay home and call Dasha (distance night).

c6_kira_downstairs.label: Chapter Six
c6_kira_downstairs.title: Five Minutes
c6_kira_downstairs.text:
Downstairs, the city hums.

Kira appears exactly at seven.

No perfume. No softness.
Just her presence—controlled, dangerous.

“Talk,” she says.

You feel the line between work and want like a wire.

choices.text: Keep it about stability: ask for mentorship and clearer expectations.
Make it personal: admit she’s become part of your thinking.
Abort: thank her and leave before it gets messy.

c6_xinyi_evening.label: Chapter Six
c6_xinyi_evening.title: Second Meeting
c6_xinyi_evening.text:
Xin Yi texts:

“Are you coming?”

No emojis.
No cushioning.

You meet her at a quiet café.

She doesn’t ask how your day was.

She asks:

“Am I part of your life, or part of your convenience?”

choices.text: Choose her for tonight: be fully present.
Ask for time again (risky).
Set friendship boundary to protect both of you.

c6_jannah_evening.label: Chapter Six
c6_jannah_evening.title: Park Lights
c6_jannah_evening.text:
Jannah meets you under streetlights.

She looks tired.

Still gentle.

You walk slowly.

At one point she stops.

“You don’t have to choose me,” she says.

“But don’t keep me as an option you soothe yourself with.”

choices.text: Reassure her with action: plan a proper date this weekend.
Be honest: you can’t promise yet.
Pull away to protect her feelings.

c6_almah_evening.label: Chapter Six
c6_almah_evening.title: Post-Shift Gravity
c6_almah_evening.text:
Almahirah arrives in scrubs under a hoodie.

She sits, exhales.

“Today was rough,” she says.

Then she looks at you.

“Tell me something true.”

choices.text: Tell her you’re scared of being the kind of man who hurts good women.
Tell her you want her, but you’re afraid of what it demands.
Stay surface-level (she notices).

c6_dasha_night.label: Chapter Six
c6_dasha_night.title: Distance Night
c6_dasha_night.text:
You call Dasha from your room.

She answers from a balcony in Sapa.

Fog makes the world look softer.

“If I stay long enough,” she says, “the town will start to feel like mine.”

She looks at you.

“Would you ever stay for someone?”

choices.text: Say yes—and mean it. Ask when she’s back in Singapore.
Say you don’t know. Be honest.
Turn it into flirting (fun, risky).

c6_collision_lift.label: Chapter Six
c6_collision_lift.title: Collision: The Lift Doors
c6_collision_lift.text:
You walk back toward the lift with Kira.

The doors open.

Xin Yi is inside.

For a half-second, all three of you understand the same thing.

Xin Yi’s gaze flicks to Kira.
To you.

Kira’s expression doesn’t change.

But the air does.

choices.text: Step out with Xin Yi (honor personal promise).
Stay with Kira (risk work boundary).
Defuse: say goodbye to both and leave alone.

c6_collision_hospital_ping.label: Chapter Six
c6_collision_hospital_ping.title: Collision: A Notification at the Wrong Time
c6_collision_hospital_ping.text:
While you’re with one person, another message arrives.

Tonight, it’s always badly timed.

A single ping can raise suspicion.

Or demand honesty.

choices.text: Show the phone and explain (integrity, high risk).
Hide it (short-term peace, long-term damage).
Silence it and stay present (boundary).

c6_crossroads.label: Chapter Six
c6_crossroads.title: Crossroads: Proof
c6_crossroads.text:
By the end of the day, you realize something painful:

Words don’t move the meters as much as *proof*.

Proof looks like showing up.
Like staying present.
Like choosing boundaries even when you want the opposite.

Tonight, you pick one concrete action for tomorrow.
Not a confession.
A *behavior*.

choices.text: Schedule a clear 1-on-1 date with Jannah (slow, steady).
Set a strict work boundary with Kira (protect both of you).
Book (or at least price) a Sapa trip to see Dasha (commitment).
Tell Xin Yi your availability and keep it (no half-presence).
Offer Almahirah a serious conversation about future and faith (accountability).

c6_end.label: Chapter Six
c6_end.title: End of Chapter Six
c6_end.text:
Chapter Six doesn’t end with a grand decision.

It ends with the smallest thing you can’t fake:

What you do next.

Continue when you’re ready.

choices.text: Continue (for now, go to Finale gate).

c7_start.label: Chapter Seven
c7_start.title: Interference
c7_start.text:
The week after Chapter Six is worse — not because anything explodes, but because everything *almost* does.

Your life is now a set of overlapping notifications:
• Kira’s deadlines.
• Jannah’s exhaustion.
• Dasha’s distance.
• Xin Yi’s patience running out.
• Almahirah’s quiet accountability.

The dangerous part isn’t the big choices.

It’s the small, unnecessary ones — the ones you make when you’re tired, proud, or craving attention.

Tonight, you choose where to begin.

And the rest of the week will react.

choices.text: Start the week with WORK: Kira requests a late meeting (just the two of you).
Start the week with KINDNESS: Jannah asks to see you after a rough day.
Start the week with CLARITY: Xin Yi wants a real answer, not comfort.
Start the week with INTENTION: Almahirah has a short break after her shift.
Start the week with DISTANCE: Dasha calls from abroad — and dares you to be real.

c7_kira_1on1.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_1on1.title: Late Room, Bright Screens
c7_kira_1on1.text:
Kira keeps you after hours.

It’s just the two of you in a meeting room with the lights dimmed to spare the eyes — dashboards glowing like a second city.

She hands you a printed timeline.

‘Your write-up was clean,’ she says. ‘I want you leading the next rollout.’

Then she pauses.

‘And I want to know if you’re stable.’

Not emotionally.

Operationally.

Her gaze flicks to your phone on the table.
A message preview slides in.

From Xin Yi: ‘Are you free?’

Kira doesn’t comment.

But she *saw it*.

And you can either reduce risk — or create it.

choices.text: Keep it clean: flip your phone face-down and stay present with Kira.
Create unnecessary tension: leave the phone visible on purpose (a silent statement).
Be brave: excuse yourself and text Xin Yi honestly that you’re stuck at work (no excuses, just truth).

c7_kira_clean.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_clean.title: Stability
c7_kira_clean.text:
You flip the phone face-down.

Kira’s eyes soften — barely.

She doesn’t reward you with warmth.

She rewards you with inclusion.

‘Tell me what you’d change about the rollout,’ she says.

For the next hour, you work like a pair that fits.

When you finish, she gathers her things and hesitates by the door.

‘If you ever decide to complicate your life,’ she says quietly, ‘do it with intent. Not carelessness.’

It lands like advice.

Or an invitation.

Outside, your missed messages wait like consequences.

choices.text: Call Xin Yi after (repair the delay).
Text Jannah to check in (small kindness).
Do nothing tonight (avoidance).

c7_kira_unnecessary_tension.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_unnecessary_tension.title: The Silent Flex
c7_kira_unnecessary_tension.text:
You leave your phone where it is.

Not because you forgot.

Because you want Kira to see that someone else wants you.

Kira stares at the screen for half a second.

Then she smiles — the kind of smile that never means comfort.

‘Understood,’ she says.

Her tone becomes colder.

You still finish the work.

But the room has changed.

Later, Xin Yi texts again:

‘So you’re with her.’

You didn’t say that.

Your silence did.

choices.text: Double down: ignore Xin Yi tonight (pride).
Repair: message Xin Yi immediately with the truth (work, not romance).
Worse choice: reply vaguely and let her imagine (cheap power).

c7_kira_honest_text.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_honest_text.title: No Excuses
c7_kira_honest_text.text:
You step out.

You don’t over-explain.

You text Xin Yi: ‘Still at work. Kira kept me. I’ll call you after. If you’re willing.’

When you return, Kira’s watching you.

‘You told the truth,’ she says.

It isn’t praise.

It’s assessment.

She slides the timeline back toward you.

‘Good. Then we can work.’

You realize something:

In Kira’s world, honesty is not romance.

It’s reliability.

choices.text: Keep the night professional and finish strong.
Ask Kira directly if she’s warning you… or protecting you.

c7_kira_edge_choice.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_edge_choice.title: Edge Question
c7_kira_edge_choice.text:
Kira holds your gaze.

‘I’m protecting the team,’ she says.

Then, a beat later:

‘And maybe I’m protecting you.’

It’s the closest thing to tenderness she’s ever offered without a disguise.

Your phone buzzes again.

Jannah: ‘Can we talk later?’

You can take the tenderness.

Or you can create damage with it.

choices.text: Accept the tenderness quietly (no theatrics).
Create unnecessary tension: send Jannah a selfie of you with Kira’s coffee in frame (attention-seeking).
Stay clean: reply Jannah normally and keep this moment private.

c7_jannah_1on1.label: Chapter Seven
c7_jannah_1on1.title: After the Children Leave
c7_jannah_1on1.text:
You meet Jannah outside her preschool.

The day is already gone, but she still moves like she’s carrying the leftover noise.

She exhales when she sees you.

‘Can we just walk?’ she asks.

No performance.
No flirting.

Just two people and an ordinary street.

Halfway through, your phone lights up.

Dasha is calling.

Jannah glances at the screen.

She doesn’t tell you what to do.

That’s what makes it heavy.

choices.text: Decline the call and stay with Jannah (presence).
Answer Dasha while walking (half-present, risky).
Create unnecessary tension: answer Dasha and step away without explanation (making Jannah wait).

c7_jannah_presence.label: Chapter Seven
c7_jannah_presence.title: Just Walking
c7_jannah_presence.text:
You let the call ring out.

Jannah doesn’t smile.

She just relaxes — like a knot finally loosened.

‘Thank you,’ she says, so softly you almost miss it.

You walk past a convenience store, past an old playground.

She tells you about a child who cried today because a parent forgot pickup.

‘Sometimes I feel like I’m holding everyone together with my bare hands,’ she admits.

You want to say something that fixes it.

But all you can do is stay.

And staying is its own kind of love.

choices.text: Offer something real: ‘Let me be part of your support, not just a visitor.’
Keep it lighter: make her laugh and change the topic (safe).
Unnecessary tension: mention you were just with Xin Yi earlier (no reason, just honesty-as-a-weapon).

c7_jannah_half_present.label: Chapter Seven
c7_jannah_half_present.title: Two Voices, One Body
c7_jannah_half_present.text:
You answer Dasha.

Her voice is crisp with distance.

‘I’m not calling to beg,’ she says. ‘I’m calling to see if you’re still the same man.’

You glance at Jannah.

She’s walking slower now.

Not angry.

Just… withdrawing.

Dasha continues: ‘If you were here, you’d understand.’

You’re in Singapore.

And suddenly you feel like you’re failing both worlds at once.

choices.text: End the call quickly and return to Jannah (repair).
Stay on the call longer (choose Dasha’s intensity).
Unnecessary tension: tell Dasha you’re ‘with someone’ (vague) and let her react.

c7_jannah_unnecessary_tension.label: Chapter Seven
c7_jannah_unnecessary_tension.title: Making Her Wait
c7_jannah_unnecessary_tension.text:
You step away without explaining.

Jannah stands still on the pavement, hands folded, looking suddenly like a person who regrets asking for anything.

Dasha’s voice on the phone is warm and sharp at once.

‘So you’re busy,’ she says.

When you return, Jannah’s expression is polite.

Polite is what people do when they stop trusting you.

You realize:

You created this tension.

For nothing.

choices.text: Apologize properly (no excuses) and ask to restart the walk.
Pretend nothing happened (cowardice).

c7_xinyi_1on1.label: Chapter Seven
c7_xinyi_1on1.title: The Room Where You Can’t Hide
c7_xinyi_1on1.text:
Xin Yi meets you in a quiet place — not romantic, not dramatic.

Just somewhere you can’t blame noise for your avoidance.

She speaks first.

‘I’m not competing,’ she says. ‘I’m observing.’

Her eyes don’t ask for compliments.

They ask for direction.

Then she adds, casually, like a trap:

‘Show me your notifications.’

choices.text: Give her your phone (radical honesty).
Refuse politely (boundary, but suspicious).
Create unnecessary tension: show her selectively (weaponized ‘truth’).

c7_xinyi_phone_honesty.label: Chapter Seven
c7_xinyi_phone_honesty.title: Radical Honesty
c7_xinyi_phone_honesty.text:
You hand her the phone.

Xin Yi scrolls slowly.

She doesn’t flinch.

Then she sets it down.

‘Okay,’ she says. ‘So the question isn’t whether you have options.’

She leans forward.

‘The question is whether you are safe to love.’

Her voice softens.

‘I can handle competition.’

‘I can’t handle confusion.’

choices.text: Offer clarity: propose one month of exclusivity with Xin Yi.
Stay honest: admit you’re not ready (risk her leaving).
Unnecessary tension: ask her ‘What if I choose Kira?’ to test her reaction.

c7_xinyi_boundary.label: Chapter Seven
c7_xinyi_boundary.title: If You Won’t Show Me
c7_xinyi_boundary.text:
You refuse.

Xin Yi nods like she expected it.

‘That’s okay,’ she says.

But her tone shifts.

‘Just understand what it means.’

She stands.

‘I’m not asking for your privacy. I’m asking whether you’re hiding because you’re kind… or hiding because you’re guilty.’

When she turns to leave, you feel panic.

Not because you love her most.

Because she’s the one who knows you too well.

choices.text: Stop her: show the phone now (late honesty).
Let her go (pride).

c7_xinyi_weaponized_truth.label: Chapter Seven
c7_xinyi_weaponized_truth.title: Selective Honesty
c7_xinyi_weaponized_truth.text:
You tilt the screen just enough.

You show the messages that make you look wanted.

You hide the ones that make you look unreliable.

Xin Yi watches, expression unreadable.

Then she says:

‘Okay.’

Just that.

But the ‘okay’ is different.

It’s not agreement.

It’s a record.

And you realize you didn’t protect yourself.

You taught her not to trust you.

choices.text: Repair immediately: confess you were selective and hand her the phone properly.
Double down: pretend that was ‘enough’ (damage).

c7_almah_1on1.label: Chapter Seven
c7_almah_1on1.title: Hospital Corridor Light
c7_almah_1on1.text:
You meet Almahirah outside the hospital during her short break.

She looks tired in a way that isn’t asking for pity.

She offers you a bottle of water like it’s an act of worship.

‘How are you?’ she asks.

And you know she means: How is your integrity?

A message pops up from Kira:

‘Need you tomorrow. Early.’

Almahirah doesn’t look at the phone.

She waits.

Because waiting is her test.

choices.text: Tell Almahirah the truth about your week (no performance).
Keep it vague (avoid accountability).
Create unnecessary tension: mention you were out late with Kira (to see if Almahirah gets jealous).

c7_almah_truth.label: Chapter Seven
c7_almah_truth.title: Plain Speech
c7_almah_truth.text:
You tell her what happened.

Not the highlights.

The weak parts.

The moments you wanted attention more than honesty.

Almahirah listens quietly.

Then she says:

‘It’s not haram to be tempted.’

‘It’s haram to be careless with other people’s hearts.’

You feel the words settle.

Not like scolding.

Like guidance.

choices.text: Ask her for a concrete rule to follow this week (discipline).
Promise change without specifics (weak promise).
Unnecessary tension: admit you like being wanted by multiple people (confession as flex).

c7_almah_vague.label: Chapter Seven
c7_almah_vague.title: Vague Answers
c7_almah_vague.text:
You give her a safe summary.

Work is busy.
Life is complicated.

Almahirah nods, but her eyes sharpen.

‘Okay,’ she says.

Then, quietly:

‘If you can’t speak plainly to me, it means you’re not living plainly.’

She checks her watch.

Break is over.

And you feel the distance grow before it becomes official.

choices.text: Correct yourself: call her back and speak plainly before she leaves.
Let her go (avoid accountability).

c7_almah_test_jealousy.label: Chapter Seven
c7_almah_test_jealousy.title: Testing the Wrong Thing
c7_almah_test_jealousy.text:
You mention Kira.

Just enough.

Not to be honest.

To see Almahirah react.

She doesn’t.

Not outwardly.

She simply looks at you for a long moment.

‘Do you want to be loved,’ she asks, ‘or do you want to feel powerful?’

The question is gentle.

That’s what makes it cut.

choices.text: Apologize immediately (own the manipulation).
Defend yourself (make it worse).

c7_dasha_1on1.label: Chapter Seven
c7_dasha_1on1.title: Voice Across Borders
c7_dasha_1on1.text:
Dasha’s video call opens on a hotel window somewhere abroad.

City lights. A suitcase half-open.

She looks at you like she’s measuring your courage.

‘Tell me something true,’ she says.

Then she smiles.

‘And don’t give me Singapore-politeness.’

Your phone buzzes mid-call.

Xin Yi.

A single line:

‘Don’t lie to me tonight.’

choices.text: Tell Dasha the truth about your situation (and accept how it sounds).
Keep it romantic and avoid specifics (pretty lies).
Create unnecessary tension: let Xin Yi’s message sit visible on screen (so Dasha sees).

c7_dasha_truth.label: Chapter Seven
c7_dasha_truth.title: Truth Without Romance
c7_dasha_truth.text:
You tell her.

Not the version that makes you look heroic.

The version that makes you look human.

Dasha listens.

Then she exhales.

‘Good,’ she says. ‘Now I know what I’m dealing with.’

She leans closer to the camera.

‘If you want me, don’t chase me when you’re bored. Chase me when it’s inconvenient.’

The call ends.

And your room feels too quiet.

Because she didn’t ask for love.

She asked for proof.

choices.text: Text Xin Yi honestly after the call (no secrets).
Text Kira to confirm tomorrow’s plan (work stability).
Do nothing (avoidance).

c7_dasha_pretty_lie.label: Chapter Seven
c7_dasha_pretty_lie.title: Pretty, Shallow
c7_dasha_pretty_lie.text:
You flirt.

You keep it light.

You make her laugh.

But you feel the hollowness of it.

Dasha’s eyes narrow slightly.

‘You’re charming,’ she says.

‘But I don’t think you’re brave.’

That sentence stays after the call ends.

Because she said it like a fact — not an insult.

choices.text: Repair: message her something true after the call (late courage).
Protect pride: say nothing (distance).

c7_dasha_unnecessary_tension.label: Chapter Seven
c7_dasha_unnecessary_tension.title: Showing Off
c7_dasha_unnecessary_tension.text:
Xin Yi’s message stays visible.

Dasha notices.

She smiles — not warmly.

‘You like being wanted,’ she says.

You try to laugh it off.

But she continues:

‘Be careful. If you make women compete for you, you will eventually end up alone — because no one respects a man who needs a crowd to feel valuable.’

choices.text: Apologize and redirect: ‘You’re right. I’m sorry. I won’t do that.’
Defend it: ‘It’s not that deep’ (immature).

c7_week_hub.label: Chapter Seven
c7_week_hub.title: Week Map
c7_week_hub.text:
The week doesn’t move in a straight line.

Pick what you do next.

(You don’t have to see everyone. You *can’t* see everyone. And if you try, you’ll start lying.)

choices.text: 1-on-1 with Kira again (work + proximity).
1-on-1 with Jannah (repair or deepen).
1-on-1 with Xin Yi (direction pressure).
1-on-1 with Almahirah (accountability).
1-on-1 with Dasha (distance test).
Skip meetings and post a vague Instagram story (unnecessary tension factory).

c7_instagram_vague.label: Chapter Seven
c7_instagram_vague.title: A Story With No Name
c7_instagram_vague.text:
It’s just a photo.

A coffee.
A city light.
A hand at the edge of frame.

You don’t tag anyone.

You don’t need to.

People infer.

Within minutes:
• Xin Yi asks, ‘Who is that?’
• Jannah goes quiet.
• Kira says nothing — which is never nothing.
• Dasha reacts with a laughing emoji.
• Almahirah leaves you on read.

You created a fire.

And now you have to choose whether you put it out — or enjoy the warmth.

choices.text: Put it out: clarify privately to the person most affected (choose who).
Enjoy it: say nothing and let everyone spiral (damage).

c7_fire_control_picker.label: Chapter Seven
c7_fire_control_picker.title: Fire Control
c7_fire_control_picker.text:
You can’t soothe everyone at once.

Pick one person to clarify to — properly, directly, without vague reassurance.

choices.text: Clarify to Xin Yi (she hates uncertainty).
Clarify to Jannah (she withdraws when hurt).
Clarify to Kira (work optics).
Clarify to Dasha (she respects honesty).
Clarify to Almahirah (integrity).

c7_kira_second.label: Chapter Seven
c7_kira_second.title: The Elevator Mirror
c7_kira_second.text:
Kira walks beside you in silence after a client call.

In the elevator mirror, you see both of you — close enough to invite rumors.

She speaks without looking at you:

‘If people talk, I won’t protect you.’

Then, after a beat:

‘Unless you’re worth protecting.’

choices.text: Stay professional: ‘I won’t make you carry risk for me.’
Unnecessary tension: joke about which girl she thinks you should pick (bad idea).
Soft honesty: ‘I don’t want rumors. I want intent.’

c7_jannah_second.label: Chapter Seven
c7_jannah_second.title: Home Doorway
c7_jannah_second.text:
Jannah invites you to her doorstep, just for tea.

No romance.

Just a quiet room.

She says, softly:

‘I don’t need to be chosen first.

I just need to know I’m not being used as a rest stop.’

choices.text: Reassure with action: set a specific day to see her again (and keep it).
Unnecessary tension: tell her you’re ‘seeing where things go’ with someone else.
Be honest: ‘I’m scared of hurting you, but I want to try properly.’

c7_xinyi_second.label: Chapter Seven
c7_xinyi_second.title: The Question She Repeats
c7_xinyi_second.text:
Xin Yi doesn’t raise her voice.

She repeats the same question until you answer it:

‘Are you safe?’

She’s not asking if you love her.

She’s asking if you will damage her slowly while calling it ‘complicated.’

choices.text: Choose safety: commit to exclusivity for a month (again, but real).
Unnecessary tension: accuse her of controlling you (deflection).
Admit weakness: ‘I don’t know how to choose without losing someone.’

c7_almah_second.label: Chapter Seven
c7_almah_second.title: The Rule
c7_almah_second.text:
Almahirah messages you one rule.

‘No ambiguous comfort.’

When you ask what it means, she replies:

‘Don’t touch hearts you won’t protect.’

It’s simple.

Which makes it impossible to hide behind complexity.

choices.text: Accept the rule and apply it this week (discipline).
Unnecessary tension: argue that life isn’t black and white (avoid responsibility).
Ask her to hold you accountable (invite her into your life).

c7_dasha_second.label: Chapter Seven
c7_dasha_second.title: The Dare, Again
c7_dasha_second.text:
Dasha sends a photo: a boarding gate.

Caption: ‘Last call.’

Then she texts:

‘If I mattered, you’d move.’

It’s unfair.

And it’s honest.

You can call her out.

Or you can admit she’s touching a truth you avoid.

choices.text: Be honest: tell her you can’t chase every time, but you won’t lie about wanting her.
Unnecessary tension: say ‘Fine, I’ll come’ then don’t commit (cheap drama).
Call her out: ‘Don’t test me with ultimatums’ (boundary, risky).

c7_crossroads.label: Chapter Seven
c7_crossroads.title: Crossroads: Attention vs Intention
c7_crossroads.text:
Chapter Seven ends with the simplest diagnosis:

You don’t only hurt people when you choose the wrong person.

You hurt people when you create unnecessary tension just to feel wanted.

If you want a good ending, you’ll need balance:
• Affection without trust collapses.
• Trust without affection becomes quiet regret.
• High tension poisons everything.

Chapter Eight will force consequences — not because the world is cruel, but because people learn.

They stop waiting for the man you *might* become.

choices.text: Continue

c8_start.label: Chapter Eight
c8_start.title: The Week That Won’t Sit Still
c8_start.text:
Monday returns, but nothing in you is routine anymore.

Your calendar is full. Your inbox is fuller. And your heart is a place people keep knocking on—sometimes gently, sometimes like they own the door.

You tell yourself you’ll be fair.
Fair like a spreadsheet.
Fair like an engineer.

But people aren’t metrics.

Somewhere between a morning stand-up and a late-night call, you realize this is the week that decides what Chapter Nine will *have to* be.

Where do you start?

choices.text: Start with WORK: Kira pulls you into an urgent review.
Start with HEART: Jannah asks for you—quietly, after school.
Start with FRIENDSHIP: Xin Yi calls you out over supper.
Start with DISTANCE: Dasha voice-calls from Sapa, wind in the mic.
Start with FAITH: Almahirah’s name appears like a memory you can’t mute.

c8_kira_review.label: Chapter Eight
c8_kira_review.title: The Glass Conference Room
c8_kira_review.text:
Kira doesn’t summon you. She *assigns* you.

A glass room. A whiteboard. A post-mortem document with your name in the header.

“You can be brilliant,” she says, voice even. “Or you can be liked. This week, pick.”

Then she adds, quieter, like it slips out:

“And don’t let your personal mess leak into my team.”

choices.text: Stay professional: own the incident, propose fixes, ask for feedback.
Make it personal: ‘I’m trying. With everything.’
Create unnecessary tension: ‘Maybe I should resign if you think I’m a liability.’

c8_kira_edge.label: Chapter Eight
c8_kira_edge.title: A Line You Don’t Cross Twice
c8_kira_edge.text:
Kira’s eyes lift—sharp, controlled.

“I don’t do emotional blackmail,” she says. “Not at work.”

Then, after a beat:

“If you want something from me, ask like an adult. If you want safety, earn it.”

choices.text: Pull back: apologize and return to work mode.
Ask directly: ‘Are you afraid of what people will think… or what you’ll feel?’

c8_jannah_after_school.label: Chapter Eight
c8_jannah_after_school.title: The Corridor of Tiny Shoes
c8_jannah_after_school.text:
The preschool is quiet after the children leave.

Jannah wipes marker stains off a table like she’s erasing a whole day.

She doesn’t flirt. She doesn’t perform.

She just says, “Can we sit for ten minutes? I’m tired of being brave.”

Outside, your phone buzzes—work notifications stacking like pressure.

choices.text: Be present: silence your phone and sit with her.
Split yourself: keep checking your phone while listening.
Create unnecessary tension: mention you were just with another girl (why?).

c8_jannah_truth.label: Chapter Eight
c8_jannah_truth.title: Soft Doesn’t Mean Easy
c8_jannah_truth.text:
Jannah’s shoulders loosen when you turn the screen face-down.

“I don’t need grand gestures,” she says. “I need consistency.”

She looks at you like she’s reading a book you haven’t finished writing.

“Are you choosing me,” she asks, “or are you choosing the feeling of being needed?”

choices.text: Answer honestly: ‘I want you for the long run, not for comfort.’
Stay careful: ‘I don’t know yet, but I don’t want to lie.’

c8_xinyi_supper.label: Chapter Eight
c8_xinyi_supper.title: Supper With No Music
c8_xinyi_supper.text:
Xin Yi chooses a hawker centre table that’s too bright for romance.

That’s the point.

“You’re not a villain,” she says, poking at her food. “But you’re also not innocent.”

She leans in.

“Tell me the truth. Are we still just friends… or are you keeping me close as an option?”

choices.text: Choose clarity: ‘I want to try. Properly.’
Hold the line: ‘Friendship matters. I don’t want to ruin it.’
Create unnecessary tension: dodge with jokes.

c8_xinyi_collision.label: Chapter Eight
c8_xinyi_collision.title: The Wrong Notification
c8_xinyi_collision.text:
You’re mid-sentence when your phone lights up on the table.

A preview banner:
Kira: “Room. Now.”

Xin Yi sees it. Of course she does.

She doesn’t raise her voice.

She just asks, “Are you going?”

And suddenly, your choice has witnesses.

choices.text: Go to Kira (work first).
Stay with Xin Yi (finish the conversation).
Try to do both: step away to text Kira, then return (half-measure).

c8_dasha_call.label: Chapter Eight
c8_dasha_call.title: Wind Over Sapa
c8_dasha_call.text:
Dasha’s voice is brighter than it should be, given the hour.

You hear wind, motorcycles, distant laughter.

“Singapore man,” she says. “Do you miss me or do you miss the story of me?”

Then she laughs—like she’s daring you to answer.

A pause.

“I might leave Sapa soon,” she adds. “Not forever. Just… gone.”

choices.text: Be bold: ‘I miss *you*. Tell me when, I’ll try to come.’
Be safe: ‘I miss talking. Keep me posted.’
Create unnecessary tension: mention you’re ‘seeing someone’ but refuse to say who.

c8_dasha_witness.label: Chapter Eight
c8_dasha_witness.title: The Screenshot
c8_dasha_witness.text:
Dasha goes quiet for a breath.

“Okay,” she says, softer. “Then don’t be a coward.”

A minute later, Xin Yi texts:
“Are you free tonight?”

Then Jannah:
“Did you reach home safe?”

You stare at the screen and realize:

Distance doesn’t reduce consequences. It just delays them.

choices.text: Reply to Xin Yi first (friendship as anchor).
Reply to Jannah first (gentleness).
Reply to Dasha first (commitment to risk).

c8_almah_message.label: Chapter Eight
c8_almah_message.title: Ten Years, One Name
c8_almah_message.text:
It’s just a name.

Almahirah.

But it pulls you back—ten years ago, when you were younger and less careful, when you thought love could survive on apologies alone.

You dated.
You failed.
You let it end.

Now fate has put her back in your orbit—Mecca, of all places—and the present day still carries that quiet gravity.

Her message is simple:
“Did you pray today?”

choices.text: Answer with honesty: you’ve been inconsistent, and you hate it.
Deflect: say you’re busy (and feel small).
Create unnecessary tension: flirt to test if she still feels something.

c8_almah_mecca_flash.label: Chapter Eight
c8_almah_mecca_flash.title: Memory: The Marble Coolness
c8_almah_mecca_flash.text:
You remember the marble under your feet in Mecca—how it was cool even when everything else was heat.

Almahirah didn’t cry when you met again.

She just looked at you like she was measuring who you became.

“I’m not here to restart,” she said then. “I’m here to see if you’ve learned.”

Back in Singapore, her next text arrives:

“Meet me. Just coffee. No drama.”

choices.text: Agree (1-on-1, accountability).
Ask for time (respectful delay).

c8_midline_hub.label: Chapter Eight
c8_midline_hub.title: Midweek: Threads Start Touching
c8_midline_hub.text:
By Wednesday, you can feel it:

• One person replies slower.
• One person watches you like a test.
• One person trusts you more than you deserve.

The city stays the same, but your week doesn’t.

Tonight, you can only be in one place first. Where do you go?

choices.text: Meet Kira after hours (work turns into something else).
Meet Jannah for a late walk (repair or deepen).
Meet Xin Yi (friend group night—until it isn’t).
Take Dasha’s call and stay on longer than you should.
Meet Almahirah (closure, or consequence).

c8_kira_afterhours.label: Chapter Eight
c8_kira_afterhours.title: After Hours
c8_kira_afterhours.text:
The office is almost empty.

Kira stands by the window, city lights breaking into her reflection.

“I don’t date subordinates,” she says, without turning.

Then she adds, very quietly:

“But I’ve been thinking about you. And I hate that I have.”

choices.text: Respect the boundary: ‘Then we stop here.’
Take the risk: ‘Then let’s be honest about what we’re doing.’
Create unnecessary tension: mention another girl to see her reaction.

c8_kira_risk.label: Chapter Eight
c8_kira_risk.title: Non-Answer, Real Answer
c8_kira_risk.text:
Kira finally turns.

Her expression is controlled, but her eyes aren’t.

“If you do this,” she says, “you don’t get to be careless. Not with me. Not with them.”

You hear the ‘them’—the other four—like a warning bell.

choices.text: Promise discretion and responsibility.
Admit you’re not ready to be that responsible (step back).

c8_jannah_latewalk.label: Chapter Eight
c8_jannah_latewalk.title: Late Walk, Small Lights
c8_jannah_latewalk.text:
Jannah meets you near a quiet park.

She walks like she’s releasing the day one step at a time.

Halfway through, your phone vibrates.

A picture from Xin Yi—friends gathered, an empty seat saved.

Then Dasha’s voice note arrives.

Jannah doesn’t look at your screen.

She just asks, “Are you here?”

choices.text: Be here: silence everything.
Split: reply to Xin Yi quickly, then continue.
Create unnecessary tension: answer Dasha’s voice note out loud while walking.

c8_xinyi_friendgroup.label: Chapter Eight
c8_xinyi_friendgroup.title: Friends, Until It Isn’t
c8_xinyi_friendgroup.text:
It starts as a group night—just food, laughter, familiar comfort.

Xin Yi sits beside you like it’s normal.

Then Kira appears at the entrance.

Not invited.
Not expected.

Her eyes flick once—professional, neutral—then linger.

Your friend group goes quiet in that way people do when they sense a story they’re not supposed to read.

choices.text: Introduce Kira as your boss and keep it clean.
Create tension: act overly close to Xin Yi (a message to Kira).
Step outside with Kira to talk (risk optics).

c8_dasha_longcall.label: Chapter Eight
c8_dasha_longcall.title: Too Long on the Line
c8_dasha_longcall.text:
You stay on the call with Dasha until the night thins out.

She tells you about her childhood in Kazakhstan—snow, open skies, a kind of loneliness that doesn’t ask permission.

“You’re quiet,” she says.

“I’m imagining,” you admit.

She laughs. “Dangerous.”

Then she asks, unexpectedly:

“If I came to Singapore, would you choose me… or would you hide me?”

choices.text: Choose visibility: ‘I won’t hide you.’
Choose caution: ‘I need time. But I’m not lying to you.’
Create unnecessary tension: ‘Depends who else is around.’

c8_almah_coffee.label: Chapter Eight
c8_almah_coffee.title: Coffee With an Old Life
c8_almah_coffee.text:
Almahirah arrives in a simple outfit, hair tied back, face calm like prayer.

She doesn’t ask about the other girls.

That’s what makes it worse.

“I heard you have options,” she says, not accusing—observing.

Then: “I was your past. I don’t want to be your excuse.”

choices.text: Own it: ‘I’m afraid of choosing wrong, so I delay.’
Ask for a second chance directly.
Create unnecessary tension: blame fate and act helpless.

c8_final_crossroads.label: Chapter Eight
c8_final_crossroads.title: Crossroads: What You’re Becoming
c8_final_crossroads.text:
By the weekend, the question isn’t “Who do you like?”

It’s:

Who are you when the choice costs you something?

You can’t keep collecting closeness like souvenirs.
You can’t keep calling it “uncertainty” when it’s really avoidance.

Make one move that defines your next chapter.

choices.text: Move toward Kira with discipline (clean up everything else first).
Move toward Jannah with consistency (choose peace, not adrenaline).
Move toward Xin Yi with clarity (turn friendship into intent).
Move toward Dasha with courage (risk the distance).
Move toward Almahirah with integrity (faith, accountability, history).
Try to keep everyone close (farm affection, lose trust).

c8_end.label: Chapter Eight
c8_end.title: End of Chapter Eight
c8_end.text:
Chapter Eight ends with weight.

Not a decision yet—just the shape of one.

The lanterns are closer than you think.

Continue when you’re ready.

choices.text: Continue to the Finale gate.

c9_start.label: Chapter Nine
c9_start.title: Mercy Night (Non-Linear Week)
c9_start.text:
Thursday arrives like a knot you can’t untie with logic.

A fundraiser invite lands in your inbox: **Mercy Night** — a hospital charity event in Singapore.

The universe, as usual, stacks the same hour with five separate meanings:

• Kira wants you there as the company’s technical face — sponsorship, optics, control.
• Jannah says her preschool is contributing handmade gratitude cards.
• Xin Yi says your close friend group is going, ‘so no vanishing.’
• Almahirah is on shift at that very hospital.
• Dasha texts from transit: ‘Layover in Singapore. Don’t laugh. Just… are you free?’

You already know what happens next.

Not a single clean route.

Collisions.

choices.text: Meet Kira before the event (1-on-1: work + boundaries).
Help Jannah prepare the kids’ cards (1-on-1: soft world, real weight).
Meet Xin Yi first — no excuses, no audience (1-on-1: the friend who knows you).
Go to the airport for Dasha’s layover (1-on-1: the rare window).
Visit Almahirah at the hospital before the crowd arrives (1-on-1: accountability).

c9_kira_pre.label: Chapter Nine
c9_kira_pre.title: Pre-Event Briefing
c9_kira_pre.text:
Kira meets you in a quiet café near the venue, laptop already open.
